8NfCn4ITriPn3BBgmS0tRw.text: This has kind of become my boyfriend's and my after church stop! This unassuming place is not only delicious, but has something for everyone on the menu. Their haddock fish fry is out of this world, and it's the same fish they throw on their soft tacos, which is usually my go-to.   The beef on weck is also a popular choice and is served with a generous amount of fries (or any side for that matter). They also have "spot tots" which are sweet potato tater tots! Such an amazing taste!   I would highly recommend checking out this dude loving, buffalo supporting bar/restaurant in Dilworth if you have the chance, you won't be disappointed!

Jbgbr6h_gfBSN8wCY7EM7w.text: What a fun place to enjoy lunch. The burgers are awesome and the service was excellent. We sat outside so we could enjoy watching the game. The patio is pet friendly. Reasonably priced and they had great beer specials the day we were there. Would love to go back!

dMETMS2D5TsBvTADDWc1OQ.text: If your hands are showing their age and you want that smoothness back, order the fried pickles. They are delicious and so salty, my hands still look like a teenagers' again (#cheatdayperk).  We were regulars at the old Township Grill in Matthews so we're already biased to like this place. Plus, I'm married to a Yankee from around Buffalo so we are always up for wings and weck!  Kids came with us this time, they're finally getting into wings (#parentingdoneright) and we needed some weck.  Sunday at 615p, it was busy but not crazy, we had a table in just a few minutes.  Love the decor, because i love The Dude.  DH and I had the wings and weck, which was good. The weck was not piled high like it used to be, maybe they sensed that portion control is not one of my strong suits? Still tender and amazing. I had the Spots (sweet potato tots, yes i had to ask) which were fine but a small portion.  Kiddos had wings and fries.  It was health food at its finest.  We'll come back on date night for White Russians and that awesome beer menu.  They run specials all week so check it out.  Plus, it's not a chain. #extracredit.

3YfHNK9VyG5q-hb4a1xl6w.text: Heard about this place recently, and seeing as how the owners are from my hometown - Buffalo, NY! - I had to try it! I was so excited to see familiar things on the menu like beef on weck , haddock fish fry and hot Buffalo wings! Let's just say I had all three. With a side of awesome fries.  SO good! The hot wings were really hot but good, not too salty. Just like we do in B-Lo! The fish was perfectly flaky and crispy. We visited on a Thursday night at about 10:00 and they were still going strong, not crowded, but not empty either.  I loved it and will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef on weck, wings and haddock fish fry. Yum!

6hfXT--UnfCe5UdiSamb0Q.text: Me: Wellp. It's getting too late to run to the store to get stuff to grill, want to go out? Lady: Everything is going to have a long wait by now! 7:30 on a Saturday?  Me: Can we at least try something? I have a place bookmarked. Casual place, shouldn't be any problem getting in.   And we didn't. And it was a really good Saturday night dinner. This was our first time here and sure as hell won't be our last. First of all, I can't commend the staff enough. The friendliest bunch of people will do anything to give you recommendations or suggestions. The food was great as well! I got their pimento burger with garlic fries (which I really really recommend), and the lady ordered the Mission Bay Salad (with the added haddock and dressing), not to be missed. I can't wait to go back and try out more of their offerings, especially their wings and Beef on 'Weck. (I know, I should've ordered this the first time I came, but that's what second chances are for, right?)

xn1aSDNePxWWBsKy7PHnlA.text: Just like a Buffalo,NY fish fry friday's.   Not to mention the beef on weck....  Reminds us yankees of home.  You guys are awesome.

41bRdj_B4k_BrwIgg4HgeQ.text: This is a great neighborhood bar and The Big Lebowski themed which makes it that much better.  Cheap beers and good specials and a decent sized menu with something for everyone. In my opinion, the Beef on Weck is a little too plain for me. I like having cheese and sauce on it so I recommend the Fredonia Dip if you're like-minded.  Hadn't tried the wings until my most recent trip, and oh my gosh were they delicious. Screw the French Dips, the wings were much better, in my opinion.  Sampled the stingers and jerkiyaki which were both incredible. The wings themselves were on the small size but the flavors of both easily compensated. Great price, great food, great environment. I love this place. Shomer Shabbos.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

QWaaLHze9y061dd_LXdl_Q.text: Constructive criticism: This place use to be "True Buffalo food" however, the owners  seem to have sold out to the south. It's a shame! They need to go back to Buffalo, eat True Buffalo food for a week, then come back to Charlotte and retrain their staff and find new food venders! If you claim to be a Buffalo Restaurant, then be one! This is a bad imitation. Rolls where "fake"  weck rolls, the Roast Beef was nothing but watery meat, chicken fingers where nothing more than Target bought strips and the sauce was nothing like True Buffalo wing sauce, and let's not go there with the fries! The Labatts was the best part of my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

gHEZeO4qOzri9gAZodkA6A.text: I wanted wings, that's the main reason we came here and it did not disappoint. They where perfectly cooked and the flavors where on point! Garlic parm & buffalo where our favorite. The hostess and waitress where very nice and attentive. The garlic fries where also great. Can't wait to come back and eat more wings!

SHbDfEcHQSojYvonMwyrDQ.text: This is a Friday night staple for us.  Absolutely love going here.  The wings are the best I have found in Charlotte!  And the Fredonia dip, wecked, has to be the best roast beef au jus sandwich I've ever had.  And the garlic fries!!!!!!!!!!!  We always try to get Jen as our waitress because she knows our usual order, but really, the entire team is terrific.  I'm almost afraid to brag on them because I just don't want it to get too busy.

WAO6yJPnJnbWRh27wlCGvg.text: One of the worst restaurant experiences I've had in recent memory (which is why I'm yelp-ing about it, normally it doesn't seem fair to complain but like, don't mess with my burger night). Things started well, we were sat, ordered drinks, ordered burgers. I ordered mine medium rare, my dad same temp, my mom medium. Burgers came. All are well done. Like, indisputably well done. Gray. Gross. My parents are like whatever but I'm like "nah this is my one night out in Charlotte (I was visiting them) and I haven't had a burger in ages and I chose this burger, so I'm not eating this hockey puck poor excuse for a med rare burger." I said that in my head, not to them or anyone else. I called the server over (who was very nice and present, not a single complaint there), and told him I'd ordered med rare and this was well done. He took it away and I waited for my burger while my parents ate their dry lukewarm burgers. The fries were ok though. Eventually my burger comes back and it's like PIPING hot, super greasy (at first I thought the grease was burger juice and I was like 'cool, this bodes well') until I realized it was in fact, just grease, and somehow, SOMEHOW, still not medium rare. How do you have a place that says they have awesome burgers and not know how to cook a burger med rare? Like at this point I have a really hot greasy burger that is somehow still overdone and dry and I'm just confused? That's almost impressive. I had the feeling that they'd maybe deep fried the burger in oil to get it done faster - it's the only explanation I could come up with. I was hungry, so I ate most of it, and then felt pretty sick (but like, I kinda blame myself for that one cause I really knew better). Like I said, server was nice but not overly apologetic. We paid and left. I'm pretty bummed I spent my night out and my burger night on this place. Definitely won't be returning.  Props for the driest but also greasiest and hottest burger I've had in a long time - maybe there's a market for that?

xjjhVsoqyYsjWniQ9Hm_4g.text: I would have to say dining here was a mediocre food and service experience.  Staff seemed friendly enough but they often disappeared for extended periods of time. We ordered hot buffalo wings for an appetizer which would be the best part of the dining experience at Lebowski's. Not overly spicy to where you cannot eat them but delivered a little kick with nice flavor.   Following the wings I ordered Durango Chicken. This dish was cooked well but left something to be desired in flavor. My other half ordered the Boss Grilled Turkey Club with side of mac and cheese. He states it was a mediocre sandwich, nothing that impressed him. Mac and cheese not as cheesy or creamy as one would want, but flavor is "alright".  Tables are exceptionally close to each other, so if you want any privacy or are trying to choose a place that welcomes long stays and good conversation, look on to other places to better fit your needs.   If you need a little positive note to end the review on, Lebowski's has a nice beer selection and they come out ice cold which is always appreciated.

CabNslR79jamGQ3B0jEOgg.text: Yay Friday!  After a long haul, my man and I wanted to celebrate the best night of the week.  We put our name in for a table and approached the bar.  The bartender immediately acknowledged, even though she was mixing a drink.  Talk about multitasking! We were seated fairly soon after getting drinks from the bar.  I ordered the veggie burger with pimento cheese and onion rings, no bun.  With fries.  Very pleased with the delightful tastes.  My honey  got haddock sliders and Mac and cheese.  He also liked his meal, although he prefers his Mac to have baked on cheese instead of mere creaminess. The really outstanding feature of Lebowski's is the staff.  Nobody acts "too cool" like some of the young, hipster hosts and servers at other establishments.  Everyone projected a sincere attitude of happy and upbeat.  They were on it with their service. TGIF indeed!

I2v-6rpQ6opXPaDjGKzLzA.text: "The best wings south of West Seneca." I couldn't agree more. Being born and raised in West Seneca, NY just represents the irony, but the food is honestly delicious and reminds me of home. My friend and I went on a weeknight and were quickly seated to the outside patio. We enjoyed some beers, wings, and sandwiches. All was great and delicious!

gbYEaZCouE8lcvviCg7_kQ.text: Good local spot for a quick bite & drinks. Solid good food. This place was semi-forgotten by me until recently, once on a "snow" day and another time on a late Sunday night. For the most part, you can always count on this place being open and serving food.   I'm a fan of the $4 house white russian - it's like dessert first, dinner later. For meal, both times I had their sliders combo - good meatloaf (next time I will ask for more gravy), great fried fish & okay chicken parm. Only downside is their side - only chips comes with sandwiches. Or you can pay extra for other side options (even fries). BUT - when you check in on Yelp, it has a Yelp offer for side order. They let me have the chili mac and it was delish and HUGE. I know everyone loves their wings here - they are ok in my book, small in size, pretty hot for mild buffalo, and generally speaking I think their other food offerings are more satisfying.  Limited parking behind the building. so good luck.  Way to go Lebowski for keeping up the good work all these years!

9eWcKG0KvJQjmL2J4ucvag.text: The wings were just ok. I've had better. I wouldn't go here if I was in search of the best wings!

HTM_Wjcz2IGeoUova1CzuQ.text: Hmm maybe I'm just not used to a SUPER casual place, because this place has pretty decent reviews but for my opinion was a little disappointing. My husband though it was ok, the food and service was good.   This is what bothers me, cleanliness and upkeep. As we walked through their parking lot the smell of garbage was palpable and walking in is just clutter all around, the place is pretty small, brooms and cleaning items where at plain view of the clients  We decided to sit outside and it was not appealing at all  the owners should invest some money here, this a pretty decent area by Dilworth. Anyhow please try the place you may like it.

ChKoPkqkVWruD3n2Hmrp4w.text: I'm not from Buffalo, nor have I ever been near that part of the world but can attest this place has the best Beef on Weck sandwich and wings I've had anywhere.  Can't comment on anything else as I never have anything other than the sandwich and wings.  Great stuff.  Friendly staff.  Can get crowded at peak times as its a small restaurant.

Q4mETO61ALrQOFvl8K1fxQ.text: Lebowski's is consistently delcious.. The half price wings on Wednesday in combination with the $2 Mystery beers makes it the highlight of the week. The garlic fries are addictive, My husband and I always need at least two baskets of them. The beef on weck, the tuscan turkey burger, the haddock and the sweet potato tots with the cinnamon honey butter is like dessert!

MStdV2zTKrRSofyXWyj2ow.text: First time here. Great selection of sandwiches we haven't had since moving down from Buffalo, NY. Waitress was great and made it a great experience

5TTvle8o7naZXW66P90vvg.text: We went with a group of 8. It was trivia night (score!) which is always a good time. However, the only cheery staff member there seemed to be the guy running the Trivia night... the rest of the servers acted like being at Lebowskis was the last thing they wanted to do, were incredibly slow, and ... just didn't smile. I mean, a smile goes a LONG way is all I'm saying.  On to the food!  I'm a wing junkie so naturally we ordered some wings for appetizers. And of course, a round of drinks. Our drinks arrived much later than they should have considering we were right next to the bar and everyone was focused on the trivia... We were really hungry and really looking forward to those carolina gold and hot wings that... never arrived. Our burgers showed up first.   I ordered the Jerk Style Burger with onions, very very tastey! I had never tried anything like it and there wasn't a crumb left. This burger has won awards, you should try it!  Back to the wings--we were told there was a "communication error" with the computers and the kitchen never got our wing order. They would be "right out." We informed our server (again) that those were appetizers and our meal was already here. We weren't impressed and let him know. Our wings came out, and were comped. They were delicious and ended up being dessert for the crew.  In short--the food was great but the service was... not enthusiastic or speedy by any means. I'll definitely go back, but I expect better service, Lebowskis!

YrSUesfFHzLnXiBwzFMJ-A.text: I absolutely LOVE this place! I feel like I am at home here, such a cozy little spot! Food is GREAT! I have never ordered anything I didn't like - I enjoy the fact that many of the dishes have a home style flare to them. BEST WINGS IN CHARLOTTE! Hands down - try the Carolina Gold - you will LOVE Them.   I work for a nonprofit organization and Lebowskis has been very helpful to us, allowing us to host events there and providing apps for our clients. This is a family run business and this family is TOP NOTCH. Good people.   My husband and I love this place so much we had our rehearsal dinner on the patio this spring.   Check them out - you won't be disappointed!

SEanaOPkmg1-54OKgzR6EQ.text: nice bar with a solid beer list. watching the Michigan and Louisvile championship game right now. lot's of tv's. I just had the chicken taco's and highly recommend them, especially durring their early or late happy hour.  Seems to be a total dude hangout, but I am here on a tuesday night, so that might explain the high percentage of sausage.  Louisville ended up winning if you didn't know.

tVsmreGE_7SHTuPPIFplKw.text: Good food can take a restaurant a long way.  Not much to say about the atmosphere, but this place has great bar food.  The patio is a great place to people watch on East Blvd while drinking a cold beverage.

YDDgnsNft8-TQ84yAXJdkQ.text: We got to restaurant at a busy time and was seated promptly outside. The atmosphere was cozy, we came with 2 children and our table was too small. We received our drinks quickly but had to wait 15 min to place our order but it was 8 on a Saturday evening so that was fine. After receiving someone else's food from a food runner we finally received our wings and the our meal. The wings were very good, the side salad was good, and all of our meals were delicious actually. My husband and I alone may return here due to the food being very good and they had a good beer selection but we will not be taking our children again. My sons kid meal was $10.25 2 sliders and apples. My daughters grilled cheese and fries was $7.75 that's including their $2.25 charge for drinks. My 7 year old could have eaten at Capital Grill for a lower price. There again great Grill restaurant but not affordable to take children.

N4JZFeQozXGq6nFfD3p0EQ.text: I've been to Lebowski's a couple of times now. I've always had a nice meal here and sitting on the patio during warmer months is a great treat!  I've had a salad, their trio (had to try the famous beef on weck!), but the veggie panini is my favorite.  Beer selection is good, and the bartender let me try a new flavor before ordering a full glass (good thing, because I wasn't a fan and ordered my usual OMB Copper!).  Service is sometimes slow but the staff is friendly, and I'm happy to support this local, family-owned place.

dbRhuyJkRmQ2Exccxaw1wg.text: Very enjoyable!  I was immediately greeted by the manager upon entering, the bartender was extremely nice and friendly!  That's rare nowadays!   I followed a reviewers suggestion and tried the wings and roast beef.   Wings were really good - roast beef was incredible!  Thank you for a pleasant dining experience, I will definitely be back!

_Xbu6vUxfoQIzXGTYJ4EyQ.text: I'm from Buffalo so I know wings and I have to say these are just like I would get back home- they are excellent!  The Beef on Weck is soooo good.  Has a relaxing chilled out atmosphere, never been disappointed here.

ctnPJC_GVN0Z1UuR9vBEuA.text: Cool little neighborhood bar.  Went there to watch part of a football game.  We were quickly greeted and sat on the patio.   We were offered water but that was the last we saw of our server for a while.  We decided on our food but she never came back.  We placed the menus on the table- maybe she thought we were still deciding.  We stacked the menus on top of each other- never saw her.  Eventually, we had to grab someone, anyone, to take our order. I had a burger (jerk style I think).  It was great.  I could have eaten 2 or 3 of them.  Someone else had the wings- they looked great and I'll be ordering them next time.  Other than waiting for what seemed like forever to place my order, I had a good experience here.  The food was good and they had a nice selection.  I will return to this place in the future.

mqVi8DObKr3DOvTsYPEk7Q.text: I met my friend for lunch here with a Creative Loafing Deal and was pleasantly surprised to see that it was quite crowded! The menu had a variety of yumminess and I opted for a side salad and the French dip.  Oh wow! Again, happily surprised! My friend ordered a buffalo chicken wrap and it was also delicious.  The CLT deal cost $7.50 and paid for our whole meal (worth $25) so it was one of the least expensive and best lunches I've had in Dilworth!  The service was prompt and attentive..... A definite Keeper for a speedy and filling lunch!

OWvyCbsUA3kLJ_rxkCfcSw.text: Don't come on Tuesdays. They reserve the whole restaurant for trivia with only reservations.

5cRU6xum0LFe3_O5kwU5wQ.text: Great wings killer drinks if you like the movie than this is rite 4 u cool drink names and great people will definitely b back

8mqMGD90moJfIciOOHV4tQ.text: I have eaten at Cantina, located across the street, many times and often thought about giving Lebowski's a try. About a week ago, my boyfriend and I decided to abandon Cantina and give Lebowski's a go.   We ended up getting there a little after 10 o'clock and had NO idea that they stopped serving their whole menu about 5 minutes before we got there! We had to select from their late night fare which includes fairly basic bar food.   I selected the Tuscan style burger with bruschetta, pesto aioli, and parmesan cheese with a side of garlic fries. The burger turned out to be really great and the fries were a great compliment. I usually prefer all the accoutrements with my burger but this one was really great on its own. My boyfriend got the Lebowski burger and loved it!  In addition to the surprisingly great food, the service and atmosphere was great. They had some really good drink specials that day and are famous for their White Russians which I look forward to trying on my next visit!

nEkxxA4MSzEdJcc8ehk-OA.text: Good food. Good service. Seems a bit over rated as I think 3 stars is deserved. If you've never been then certainly pay them a visit. Decent beer selection and varied menu in a pretty laid back setting. We had the beef on weck, beef and provolone sandwich, and BBQ sandwich --- nothing special but not bad. Fries were not to our liking, tater tots were yummy, Mac n cheese was OK. 3 solid stars.

n8kNb9ziyOBVSJgunbKmeQ.text: If you love roast beef, you must have the beef on weck! What a great sandwich. I thought about giving this place 3 stars but I thought harder and I feel it deserves 4. The wings are probably my favorite in the Charlotte area, in fact, this is the only place that I crave wings from.  The beef on weck was amazing.  I wanted to try something different so I had the chicken sandwich, jerk style because the waitress confirmed that it was really good and my husband had the Fredonia Dip.  I did not enjoy the "jerk style" on my chicken sandwich, although the chicken was fine.  My husband said his Fredonia dip was good but not as good as the Beef of Weck.  Overall, the food is great.  Oh...did I mention the garlic fries?  Those are yummy too!  A great place to hang out for lunch, everyone is friendly and it has a great patio with a TV to watch football!  I think I might stop by for a beer one night too since it has a cute little bar - but be warned, it's not big and doesn't have a lot of stools.

TMBRjYlYB7Y43FDJabPbHw.text: Nice place located in the heart of Dilworth and the East Blvd corridor. Stopped by for lunch recently and sat outside on the nice patio. Waitress was nice, but a little slow considering the amount of tables that day. Not a big deal because the weather was beautiful outside and I had PBR in hand.   Ordered the chicken wings and the roast beef sandwich. I was told the chicken wings would take a little long (20 minutes) so I appreciated the heads up. That said; I love me some wings and have ordered them at several locations around town, both chain and non-chain. They've never taken that long, so I was curious. Needless to say, wen they arrived they were typical wings so I wondered why the 20 minutes was necessary. However, they were good and I went with the special sauce, which I can't remember at this time, but the waitress recommended it and it was flavorful. The roast beef sandwich was pretty good. My only complaint was the extra salt on top of the bun. Added a little too much salt as the au jus hand more than enough.   This is the first restaurant that has a chance to make it in this spot as the former ones kept changing every year. I'll be back to try some other items soon.

mToUoUrvdmdLhhbgwzlSbQ.text: I wasn't really sure about this place at first.  With a Big Lebowski theme, you would expect more of a west coast vibe.  This place is all New York east coast atmosphere.  I had the Beef on weck, and it just didn't hit the spot.  The True star of my meal was the garlic fries.  I rarely eat fries anymore, but I'm pretty sure I get these guys every time I come here.  My hetero life mate had the Buffalo Trifecta.  The blackened wings were really bland.  We each tried one, and then never touched them again.  The fish was amazing.  That's what I'll be ordering next time I'm there.

u79n4f70UwZcDSh10ropMA.text: I try to go here every Thursday night because of the free local music and the $3  beer menu.  After living in Charlotte for a few months I am a little sick of paying $6+ for every beer, so I appreciate a place with a solid beer menu with a chill vibe.  Food is pretty good, recommend the pork, beef on wheck and the hamburgers. The wings were pretty awesome until they caved to customer pressure to cook them faster.    Overall great place to chill with some friends if you want a pretty solid beer list with some good music and food.

XMOgSeBpUkeZXIf42Nr8kA.text: Great bar food, has it's own parking (although tight), which is a plus in this neighborhood.  My son had the Burger (Medium!) 4 Stars and Garlic fries (rockin!) 8 Stars :)  I had the Beef on Weck...which was probably the best I've had outside of Buffalo. 5 Stars  Wings were cooked great...not a big fan of their Hot Sauce...but could be a personal preference....would rate them 3.5 stars  Look forward to going back when I get to have a beer or two

-Q7Pffl6zYjjjsa1vNhoQw.text: Not a place you expect to find great food...but you do. Good selection of local beers as well.

LFGwkZF7q0P6662fCx39tw.text: Cute and cozy neighborhood restaurant in downtown Charlotte. I loved the atmosphere, and the fried pickles were great. I had high expectations for the fried haddock based on previous reviews and marked as a house favorite-it was good, not amazing. Maybe the breading wasn't my favorite? I couldn't really put my finger on it. The garlic fries were also pretty good, and the boneless medium wings were spicier than expected (but still tasty). The coleslaw however, I hated. The vinegar was really strong in it, and to be fair, I'm hard to please with coleslaw to begin with. Overall I would still come back to try other foods. The staff was friendly and attentive. Wish there were half stars to bump up this rating a little more.

sj2gUPcwUCL6gC-EPyu1Nw.text: I transplanted here from Western NYS right after Bills went 0-4 in Superbowl attempts.  Yes, it still hurts.  Lebowski's understands this and provides their form of healing with booze, wings, beef-on-a-weck, and fried haddock (no, not Cod.  They understand).  When I'm feeling I need a little hug from home,  I drop in and rekindle my spirit with their's.    Service has always been spot on, the food hot and homey, and the price easy on the cash flow.  Go Bill's.  Go Lebowski's.  And, go Panther's, of course!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Full-sized Haddock comfort food.  Yes!
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jr size haddock dinner

m1iBacOcAGsrfv_Ek8hKMw.text: I have been to Lebowski's a few times now and I've always had a good experience. The wings are by far the best thing on the menu. They also have many different daily specials. They have a great trivia night on Tuesdays. The host is pretty funny and the trivia questions are enjoyable. They also make a very good White Russian.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

w6zbYHDlw4Zd8p67u7elnA.text: Not impressed.  We are life long (50 years) Buffalonians who moved to Charlotte just two years ago. We found the food to be mediocre at best. My daughter and I each had the "Buffalo" chicken wrap and found the chicken to be grizzly. The blue cheese tasted like the Friday night tartar sauce with some chunks of cheese added in. My hubby had a beef on weck slider which was served cold. The fish fry is not Buffalo's traditional beer battered style, although it had decent flavor. The wings were limp and not cooked crisp. The atmosphere reminded us of a Buffalo tavern but really is grungy and needs updating. The ceiling fans are filthy, thank goodness they were not turned on. Won't be back.

uq4XBsjCbrAPOYKtzUZHKg.text: What can I say great wings great beer great sliders all at a even better then great price. Lebowski's is one of the True neighborhood spots that turns it out right every single time. Haven't had something I don't like off the menu

F5iYGtRKShZumU4xh_7RQQ.text: If you live around the Dilworth/Myers Park area you've probably heard that Lebowski's has some of the best wings in town. I've thought that to be the case too but it's not. How bad is it? Well it's to the point where I'm writing my first yelp review to prove a point. I went in tonight to get 20 wings to go, 10 buffalo and 10 blackened. The buffalo were below average. Which is a major red flag because if you can't satisfy me with the most standard chicken wing in the game, you shouldn't be playing. The blackened wings were a whole new level of bad, just have a look at the picture. I'm all for the dry rub, but these wings weren't blackened underneath, they were straight burnt. If you want good wings, better make the drive down to the Moose.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

A1rYK10aq8GgC5GCGugYDQ.text: The food was okay , I had 3 sliders (buffalo chicken, meatloaf and turkey) chips and apple beer along with pimiento cheese dip. I meet up with a few coworkers to enjoy happy hour.  Customer service was average kinda like they was rushing us to leave out. We had a very cultured mix background of people at the table ...  I won't make a special trip from Union Co to eat at this establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

HUyc1bO4VLCx6YoBY394sQ.text: First off I had a Groupon, but I meet my father here for lunch from SC and it's got an amazing atmosphere feels like uptown but without all the headache of being in uptown, we both had the beef on weck A++ can't recall having any better roast beef.  I'll be going back again soon Groupon or not

5B7CeTG4q4h0DXLi3VTbLQ.text: After a long day of rock climbing my boyfriend and I found this place on yelp. Awesome vegetarian options and he got the best burger he's had since we moved to Charlotte. Our waitress Elizabeth seriously went above and beyond to make our meal that much better. Well definitely be going again!

D1ZhxbgyW2BaqvpSuzjo4A.text: We ordered the fried fish and garlic fries. The garlic fries were really flavorful, and very crunchy. The fish was a bit dry, and the seasoning/flavoring was mediocre.

EmRnQc1vHWm2CqArmk9NDQ.text: I wanted to try a new restaurant out that sold great wings and that's what I got here. I got wings, garlic fries, and the chili mac n cheese and all of it was great. The service was great and the manager even came around to ask how was everything. I definitely suggest going here for their meaty wings.

EptLGkG99lBKo3i4fYgzIQ.text: This place is no frills for sure. In a good way. We were looking for somewhere to watch some March Madness and decided we should go to the place that claims to have the best wings in Charlotte. Crowded on a Friday night and we had to wait a little for a table. They have a good bottle/can selection and a whole menu of white russians (of course).   I could have thrown a dart at the menu and been happy with whatever the outcome was. Everything sounded good.   Being there for the duration of the game, we started with wings. Yep, they are good. I loved the hot buffalo sauce, thought the garlic parm dry rub was a little boring. The blue cheese dressing is very good, you can tell its homemade. We also got a small order of the buffalo chicken nachos. Not my favorite since there wasn't any melty cheese to keep the toppings on the chips.   But the crispy haddock. Wow. I would never think to order fish and chips in a restaurant, but I kept seeing everyone's plates come out and it looked amazing. Definitely the best fried fish I have ever had. The tarter sauce it comes with is great and the garlic fries are a must-get! Also split the roast beef on weck. It was really good, I loaded mine up with the horsey sauce.   My only regret is not saving room for a white russian. We enjoyed our meal so much we went back to watch the Sunday game too!   They have great daily food specials and a lot of combination plates when you cant decide what you want. You can even get a combo with fish, a beef on weck slider and 6 wings! Best of everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings!
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Niagra street nachos
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy haddock with garlic fries

nBNnKhEtrwcTYvhp5YdNvA.text: First time customer will definitely be returning. Great food quality.  The wings exceeded our expectations. My daughter really enjoyed the mac and cheese with apples. Our server was very attentive too.

xpHHWI_PepXIBvvz7F_CHQ.text: This place is amazing. I like to sample different things on the menu if it's my first time going to a place. The ambiance is cool! I took the little ones with me as well so it is definitely kid friendly. I had the large haddock platter and this fish is huge!!! So come hungry. I also ordered the haddock slider, honey butter chicken slider, and 1 buffalo cauliflower taco. Everything was amazing! No complaints! My daughter had the burger sliders and my son had the grill cheese...

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

vDIOJ4---DmjJryFJpjCzw.text: Great drinks. Wings are good. Do not order the French dip. Plain, no taste and tough meat.

0-j5SeacVfzt3I0YiWLlXA.text: Nice little place with the best wings you will find in Charlotte. And even if you don't like wings, they have great burgers and Beef on Weck. The service is wonderful as well.

1C6g8R-4uzbZHSx2FvSqCg.text: As usual, the food was fantastic! Service tooLove this atmosphere as well. Reminds me of being in western NY!

JpEbsvw1UWly8mVbamz5Jw.text: The Jerk Burger never disappoints, it's my go-to here!  Fries fresh and fried to perfect crispness. The wings, salads and haddock fish plate also on point .  What I love about this place is it's unpretentious neighborhood hangout vibe and awesome service   What more could you ask for ? *****

SbzxDyfawsLYWyKMYiTaOg.text: Just moved to Charlotte full time this summer and had Lebowski's on my list of places to try. Went to dinner here Saturday with a small group of friends and was in heaven! I first walked in and felt I was home (Cleveland, OH) up North with their Buffalo sings and the smell of sweet comfort food. Atmosphere, 10! Waitress, 10! Now onto the food. So much to pick from and only so much room in my belly. I split the chicken nachos and one their burgers. First off the chicken nachos were just average, as the waitress warned me. But the burger was so so delish!! The buttered bun added that north Home taste. Wings are my next must try on my next visit!!! Great place for food and fun!

xldcjAIPd8VWnF-59DY8PA.text: I visited here for the first time today. I was veeery  impressed with the taste of the food but disappointed with the small amount of fries they offered for free with the  Yelp coupon .  The meal was still a little pricy. I only ordered a Haddock fish sandwich w/ garlic fries and the total was  $9 and remember the fries were free. I'll definitely visit again but for dinner instead of lunch.

e45wAUUEFynj3-NibruzAQ.text: We were missing home (western New York natives) and didn't realize how much we missed wings!  Excellent service and food! Can't wait to go back for fish fry and Bills games!

kaTgpDMKYTIA4FWX9yIkrg.text: I've been coming to Lebowski's for years and it just keeps getting better. Love the staff, love the beer, and the food is always consistent and delicious. This time I asked for extra shredded lettuce on my turkey burger (Anchor Style - wing sauce and blue cheese crumbles) and they delivered! See the attached photo. Can't say enough good things about the place. I'll be back again and again and again. :^}

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. This MY turkey burger. Anchor Style (wing sauce and blue cheese crumbles) with extra shredded lettuce. YUMMO!!!

4Zn91a8cQPriDCVWvhk6EA.text: Where do I start...friendly service from the moment the phone is answered and to me that's important. The food, OMGoodness the food, is beyond AMAZING! I can honestly say it's the best food I've had in a very long time (and my family orders takeout a lot) each time better than the time before. For anyone who loves pulled pork, their Memphis Style sandwich is nothing short of spectacular!!! Tender and juicy on grilled sourdough bread with pepper jack cheese, I didn't even know I liked pepper jack cheese, it's easily become my new favorite meal. Sandwiches come with chips but I spend the extra 99 for the cinnamon apples (the best I've ever tasted). My son loves the Lebowski burger which comes with roast beef and queso, quite the combination and not one I ever would've thought of but delicious! Definitely a place worth trying, repeatedly

vH71hQvN61YwLFmaSLPbWw.text: Only been once, before moving to Alabama for school.   It took awhile for us it get a table, and when did, it was on the patio, which was crammed up feeling since we had 3 people sitting at a 2 person table.   The food was really good, I think I ordered the E-Street as my memory serves me right. Had that with OMB Copper. Love the location, besides finding a parking spot, but that can be anywhere on East blvd.

gwePyqBVFyV7jcLChSTBkA.text: Really cool atmosphere with outdoor area. My brother in law loves the movie so all the memorabilia was a trip. Wings are great, very traditional buffalo style. Good selection of local brew. Very well done sports bar.

jjkVljzdazPgYAfHEBVAnQ.text: So, in a few words: I'm a fan of this place.   I'll try to get through this entire review without dropping any cheesy Big Lebowski references....Well, okay, maybe a couple.   My favorite night to come here is on Wednesday night, as they have half priced wings & a "mystery" craft beer special. It's a great way to inexpensively sample your way through the wing combos, and taste a few unique brews along the way; I've definitely stumbled upon some really great beers this way. I wouldn't think that you MUST order a White Russian while you're here, but if you do--they are on special for a reduced price as well . Personally, I'm not much of a fan of the caucasian...but you know, that's just like, my opinion man.   As for the other menu items besides the (oh so delicious) wings, Lebowski's serves up an array of bar food from the Upstate NY region. I'm talkin' Beef on Weck, White Hots, Fish Fry...you get my drift. I'm sure you can definitely come in here on Sunday, watch the Bills lose, drown your sorrows in massive amounts of Blue Light & Genny Cream Ale, and talk about where you were when Frank Reich led the comeback against the Oilers.   So, if this all sounds like fun (and it should), you should definitely check them out. FYI, the parking lot can fill up in a hurry, so just be prepared to find a spot down the street if you can't get in their actual lot.

8Kqgi5EfYwmXQSleFXS-aw.text: This is a neighborhood bar with decent food. We started with the wings. They were good but not amazing. I was disappointed that they did not allow me to order all flats. Craving more buffalo action, I ordered the buffalo wrap. Skip the lettuce and add the fries. It was delicious and loaded with breaded chicken breast chunks and tomatoes and buffalo sauce. My friends enjoyed their dinners also and ordered the mystery beer special where the bartender selects the beer. It worked because they enjoyed the selection. I will be back to try other entrees.

TQDaZLqM3IVebZ-YPIygNg.text: The best wings I've ever had bar none. Also good fried pickles and garlic fries. This place will not disappoint.

ANBOsaGvMJVbjJ6cMpr0jQ.text: Love this place..just had fish tacos for lunch. I should have written this review a long time ago, as it's become quite a regular spot for me.   While many assume it's a pun on the movie, it's really a Buffalonian's Hot Spot at heart. Featuring wings, beef on wecks, and haddock fish fry, you would most likely get the same response from anyone that's from upstate NY, Lebowski's is where it's at! I'm not from Buffalo, so I speak only on hear say from other folks I've met around CLT. Growing up here in Charlotte, I must say they rank among the top of my favorite Chicken Wing spots. That Jerkiyaki is off the charts. For the vegetarians out there, they actually have some great veggie options as well, and their Mission Bay Salad (I add haddock) is ridiculous.   Yes the Dude Abides! They do play a little off of the movie featuring The Dude, for all you Big Lebowski lovers. You'll find several movie references mixed in with the Buffalo decor and fan fare. With several specialty White Russians, this place a must if you like a good Caucasion to sip on. Great beer options as well, both local and national craft options, along with all your standards.  Staff is laid back, but personable and helpful if you need any suggestions. There is a lot to choose from on the menu.

tURhH6ADj3VRX8wxs1Bcwg.text: The Best Buffalo Wings In Charlotte Period.

YlfF8exGi329DzMtqVYYwg.text: Great service, amazing food (I recommend any of their burgers and their chicken fingers are awesome), big selection of beer. Only thing that I wish could be changed is the lack of parking. It's super hard to find a space here on busy nights. Guess that's a good thing, though...they're busy!! Super chill atmosphere.

lzMsK4Z1MYcNT5OhuH7MhA.text: Hands down the best fish tacos and fish & chips in town!!! Small restaurant/bar but surely a place to try : ) they will run a living social deal here and there $10.00 for $20.00 worth of food.   Parking is plentiful for the restaurant but can be tight at times.  Definitely a place to try!

MSniVqHUcgGnv4phM1LRig.text: $3 mystery beers, now that's True local love!  Just pulled a Ruby out of Hickory.  The yocals seem to be repeat customers, I dig the small joint feeling.  I paid my tab, which means I would like to return!

MG2ai4E5AlEqUEuLnI_8Ig.text: Well, I was taking my wife to Jack in the Box as she had never eaten at one and when we arrived it was no longer in business. The first thing I did was rip out my iPhone and hop on Yelp. This place popped up and the reviews seemed good. We headed around the corner and we were very glad we did.   I ordered the VeraCruz style Turkey Burger with the Mac & Cheese. I will admit that the Mac & Cheese was good but nothing to scream and shout about. It was better than most that I have gotten while eating out though. The Turkey Burger on the other hand is awesome!   My wife ordered the Lebowski burger which was a HUGE beef burger with roast beef on top with queso. She loved it. I had a bite and I would have preferred just the burger and queso, not the roast beef but I am not a huge fan of roast beef to begin with. On the side she got garlic fries. Again, Awesome!   We also tried the Bloody Mary. This was the best Bloody Mary I have had in a while. We also tried a couple of the many beers they have and some shot... I believe it was a whip it. Not sure but it was incredible.   Last but not least... Lizzie. AWESOME server!!! She was very friendly, knowledgeable of the menu and good conversation.   This place is great. If I lived in Charlotte this would be one of my regular hang outs.

TkCyd4S1jvFtE3iE9tdRiw.text: Came in on a Friday and had their dinner special (Crispy Haddock Filet and homemade Crab Cake with Chili-Lime Aioli, fries and coleslaw) with a Stranger White Russian... Both were great choices, but the crab cake on the special could use a little something... Not sure what, but it didn't really blow me away...  The White Russian was insane... I haven't stopped thinking about it since... lol I'm kind of mad it took me this long to go here since I'm actually from Charlotte! lol

Mzrl0gw-tgX2YPVyj2vYvw.text: "You're not wrong Walter..."  Tonight was my group's second trip to Lebowski's for trivia and we had sort of a... weird night.  I can't really be angry.  The buffalo wings were excellent.  The staff was friendly.  But man...  Trivia starts at 8, we get there at 7:45.  There were several groups milling around and the hostess looked a little frazzled.  She took our name, maybe a few groups ahead of us.  As we're waiting more and more people are showing up and being seated from a reservation book.  Did you know Lebowski's took reservations?  I wouldn't even think about it but I can accept that trivia is popular.  One of the reasons I was interested in the place is my brother has been to trivia dozens of times - never heard of the reservation book.  Well we waited, and waited.  We were offered a table outside but my friends turned it down.  The thing that irritated me, and I'm sure this is something you fixate on when you're waiting to be seated but - For nearly an hour a group sat with their check on their table.  As near as I could tell, and I was staring them down like a complete weirdo, no staff came by to hurry them along.  They weren't playing trivia and it was a packed house.  We were standing up playing.  We finally snagged a table, not the one I was obsessing over.  Those folks stayed over an hour after having finished.  We decided to go ahead and leave after eating.  We missed getting our question sheet for the second round amidst the hubbub of getting seated.  So a lot of this isn't Lebowski's fault but I really felt like whoever is behind restaurant karma wasn't on our side tonight.  If I was with someone lingering that bad at the table I'd just leave them there.

YzR1oJRXrvll-d_jaXx6hA.text: Lebowski's has excellent food, great service, good drink specials, and best of all, it's not noisy. You can have a conversation with others at your table without having to shout.  Something to note, though, is that their parking lot is a bit awkward--it only has one entrance, which is also the exit. I generally find that if the lot is full, it means that there aren't any open tables.

BiKGLReh21wzGdlb_P6G4w.text: THE DUDE is in town!  I love going to this place.  The decor is amazing if you like The Big Lebowski.  I try to buy the John Goodman pixel painting but it's a staple to the restaurant.  They have many different varieties of things to order whether for lunch or dinner.  I usually go with the three sliders so I can have a different taste of multiple things.  My wife usually gets the fish and fries and douses them in vinegar.  They are excellent!  It's not a very big place but if you go at the right times you shouldn't have that long of a wait.

8moIwj9vrHHo0SBPDhJspw.text: Determined to shake up our Saturday lunch routine, hubs and I stopped by Lebowski's to try their famous wings and take in a bit of college football in the mean time.   The first impression is a bit nondescript - Lebowski's looks like many other sports bars in Charlotte and has a nice little patio facing East Blvd. Because Mother Nature gave us a break from the 90s, we chose to sit outside and enjoy a relaxing lunch (hubs was especially happy as there are TVs outside, too!). Both the hostess and our server weren't the cheeriest of individuals...it seemed like they both had a long night out. Regardless, hubs went with the Carolina Gold wings and the Beef on Weck, I choose a side salad and the small version of the Chili & Mac 'n Cheese.   Upon ordering our server informs us that the wings take about 15-20 minutes to cook. Um...ok...that's a little odd, but we would still like them. This was noon on a Saturday in a not-so-busy restaurants. Now, I'm not a wing eater but even hubs said that that's a long time to wait for six wings. So, basically the entire time we were joking with each other that the cook had to go fetch the chickens and take care of them so he could have his wings in less than 20 minutes.   And yes, it did take 20 minutes for these wings to reach our table. I'll let hubs review his own food. As for mine...the salad was fresh but not too much to report. Their side salad included bits of iceberg and romaine, a flat crostini and a few other veggies.   As for my Chili Mac 'n Cheese, it was pretty tasty albeit the chili was a bit sweet. I had a different expectation...when I saw a cup of chili mac 'n cheese I expected a cup of chili with a bit of mac 'n cheese at the bottom. I was a bit suprised when I saw a flat dish of mac 'n cheese with a small scoop of chili on top. No worries, though, I ate it up - it was a nice little serving.   Will I be back to Lebowski's? Sure...for a few beers and maybe a snack, but I don't think it's going to make it into my trusty lunch spot list.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Daily drink specials

1w1V_NMgvldKy7jxaEB4Zw.text: Delicious meal at Lebowski's tonight! We had the fish fry and the beef on weck. Fish fry, great as usual. First time for the famous Beef on weck and not disappointed. Beef, bun, and horsey sauce were sublime. Good review for side house salad, blue cheese dressing, service, and tartar sauce .

eengXH7nVF8fBj_KJMArhw.text: Lebowskis is my new favorite comfort place. I only wish I lived in walking distance. Very fresh vegetables can always be found in the salads. This last time I ordered the vegetable pita and it was fresh and just right. Lebowskis is perfect for late night food. Kyle is an excellent bartender, he made me feel welcome the first time I visited and recognized me the next visit. I feel very comfortable at Lebowskis.

L0xlzhrZN0utXu3vVBCzaA.text: So good! I live in Dilworth but today was my first time at Lebowskis. I had the sliders and they were amazing! The turkey was my favorite though the chicken parm was delightful. Service was great.. Attentive and polite. Great place!

VaRDPOekiedBhM5M258FrQ.text: Got a taste of Triple C Brewing "The Dude Imbibes" tonight at Lebowski's. I love that I can come to Lebowski's and get access to special local brews!  Lebowski's also offers sweet potato tots with a creamy, sweet dipping sauce...mmmm!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Triple C &#34;The Dude Imbibes&#34;

bQA-3jZ54wwqt5RGImmh7Q.text: Lebowski's is one of those restaurants where I always think about switching up my order and not getting the same thing every time.  But then I remember how good the beef on weck sandwich is, and I order it again and again and again.    They piled your weck roll high with thin sliced, already dipped in au jus roast beef.  (They'll give you more au jus for .49 cents extra, you don't reallllly need it, but I always get it anyway).  The employees are usually very friendly.  Last night we were seated inside, but right next to the patio door.  Every time the door opened you could smell someone's cigarette, when we asked to move the hostess was happy to accommodate us, and we slid over a few tables.  This place is a great neighborhood stop for lunch or dinner.

8fvDMlfxqjnr3cgzax3M2g.text: This is our go-to place.  Great for during the week happy hour -  or a stop on a date night -  or weekend meal with our kids.  Place is very kid friendly.  Beer is cold - great selection of locals.  Wings are legit - get the gold rush (you're welcome).  Also get the fish fry or fish sammy both are good.  Hamburgers are solid.   Staff is friendly.

L1iXIbCzhchk8UdPw4CEag.text: Quite possibly one of the best food joints in all of Charlotte. I am pretty sure at one point I was eating at least 2-3 meals here a week, granted I was also within walking distance. Obviously if you've ever stepped foot in here then you know its a Buffalo, NY establishment. I have known a couple people from up there who have had no problems driving from places like Kannapolis and Matthews just to dine here.  I highly recommend the Wings (I prefer the gold rush), the Memphis Panini, or the Jerk Burger. To be honest though the best deal is probably the chicken tenders because you get a side as well getting them tossed in wing sauce, which makes them amazing.    If its a gorgeous night out I highly recommend sitting on their patio, although its relatively small it's a good atmosphere. Plus you can bring your four-legged friend if you want. The wait staff is extremely friendly and has become part of the reason I return week after week.   Even though this place is small they have a good size beer selection. But whats even better is that they have chosen the perfect beers to both compliment their food and their clientele. However what they are really known for are their white russians, which by the way are only $4 for the house version. They also have a small bar inside in case you want to just grab a drink, chat with the bartender, and/or catch a sporting event.

ktvApJlLV8KcgZT242MXRw.text: Great place!!!   Found it by yelping fish on the way to Florida.  We liked it so much we made a point of staying in Charlotte on way  back to Ohio.  Had the haddock and garlic fries, delicious, even junior size is plenty.  Husband had french dip  and really enjoyed it!  Service was great, only negative is the parking lot! Will hit it up every winter on journey south:).

ikoRZmQ_fbSa16Ay4pWihw.text: My food was great! Ordered The Boss, it's a turkey club, it was awesome and garlic fries!!! Love, love, love! The service was pretty slow, but she was friendly. I would definitely come again!

GSEFdyjiy_N9RUTkhvuMmQ.text: Definitely one of my staples in Charlotte.  Their weekly specials are a hit! I love getting the haddock taco and the jerkiyaki wings.  All of their food is really delicious.  I come here pretty frequently, and we even went for new years eve.  It was perfect! Not a huge crowd, everyone was out partying the night away. I think they were gonna close early, but it was nice to still be able to go out and enjoy a quick bite to eat.  The fact that they are open later than most food spots in the area is perfect.  My go to for late night snacks. They also carry options from local breweries which is always nice.

p4A6Dk0iBT8GGubTlzVEBw.text: We were at Lebowski's a few months back for a few beers and we were impressed with the sincerity of the bartender, so now we live in Charlotte and we had to go back for food and we were not disappointed. Wings with sweet honey chili sauce were nice and crispy, needed no Blue Cheese or any other sauce. PLT sandwich (Pimiento, Lettuce and Cheese) was great. I had the burger with Pimiento and onion rings, it was phenomenal, as were the garlic fries.  My only concern was that it seemed that the bathroom walls and ads behind the urinal hadn't been cleaned in a long time, they looked very dusty. Overall, I will be back often!

OMUl5zdhbfG3QIV2TfU9xA.text: Needed a quick meal before going to nursing school clinical's and boy did we get a delicious one!    I had the Beef on Weck.  Tender roast beef, piled high on a bun that's covered in salt, spices, and herbs.  It comes with a very rich flavorful au jus that you can't stop dipping into.  My side item was the Mac and Cheese with Pecan Bacon...absolutely scrumptious.  Like I said we were in a hurry and had to get over to the hospital but they were super fast with our order and everybody's was cooked perfectly.  Will be back and soon!!

2i8MhYV31NHtkYmvstryRw.text: Great, friendly service. Nice atmosphere. Really awesome fried pickles!! Seriously, try the fried pickles.   I like the chicken strips tossed in buffalo sauce, the fries are good.   Lots of weekly specials. Overall great place.

K9tlmvRAxtgOXklJzhncog.text: This place is a typical neighborhood pub however they have good food fully stocked bar and beers on tap. Usually a good crowd on weeknights and on weekends. They also have bar games. It's in a good location in Dilworth. This is not my favorite spot however good to revisit every now and then.

QFjBwRgtW9DK0srHrSIJaA.text: Really good food with ample portions! I was a little turned off by the $9 price on the pimento cheese app but I saw what I got and then understood. I was born and raised in Buffalo so chicken wings are a stand alone food group for me and I'm very critical! Usually I buy dry wings and make my own sauce (Franks Redhot and melted butter is all it is people!!). Let's be honest, the wings are blue cheese are not dead on like you get in Buffalo but they were still very good! I got the Buffalo style which were advertised as being medium (that's how I like my wings anyway) but they were too spicy, also they didn't taste like the classic Franks/melted butter sauce...maybe bc it was too spicy for me to get into them too much. I also tried the Gold Rush which were a tad spicy but very good but still not like the BBQ wings you get in Buffalo! But maybe that's what they weren't going for which is ok. Lastly, the blue cheese tasted home made and I really loved it, it just wasn't like Rooties or any other classic blue cheese you might get at many spots in Buffalo. I'm giving this place 5 stars because the food was really good all at reasonable prices and being from Buffalo I love the concept. Again, not dead on like you get in Buffalo but pretty darn close and very good!!

YORTzmx3f23uCrehq2IKQQ.text: WE loved this place.  The food was great and the service was brisk and friendly.  I will be back!

7oU2aHMrYFG9N32LqAj-Rw.text: Lebowski's is my favorite bar in the Dilworth area. It's what I like to call a "feel good" bar. They have really good bar food - you can't go wrong with the apps, wraps, sandwiches, or wings and they also have a solid beer selection. I've always had great service here. There are plenty of tv's to watch the game and they have a nice dog friendly patio. This place has a great atmosphere for all.

gIaBDPktfX0pcAcwJG7usw.text: Great food, low key vibe. Love this place. Great place for any Upstate New Yorker who resides in the Charlotte area to get some home style wings and bar food. Also, who can beat $2 Labatt's anytime down South?

v2vXL15ij0Ul06dT_kzSLA.text: Great food, friendly service, big portions...NC pints only $4 on a Friday! Nothing fancy but they really do it right. I will definitely be back.

g79eJK9zLvXL42pfrR9p3g.text: There were 4 of us and we all got different things. The beef on weck was excellent, the fish was amazing, the burger was very good, and the wings/slider combo: bones were broke and small. Mac and cheese was great but we needed more cheese- they did add it without question! Fries were awesome and fried pickles were super, but a bit too salty!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef on weck with Mac n cheese

wcONfeq5e_jjY4s6uoTf_g.text: I really like this place! I don't know why I don't stop by more. First time I headed over my friend and I sat on the patio and sipped on beers. Not a huge beer menu but think I've been spoiled by the places with 40 or so beers on tap. You can always take your chances with a 'mystery beer', which is really just whatever random beer they pull and charge you $2 for haha.   Last time I headed over was for lunch. Parking in the back can get tight and can be a challenge getting out as well so be prepared. But anywho, ended up getting a half-priced deal so headed over to meet a friend. I order the buffalo chicken wrap and my friend opted for the French dip and we both had side salads - it was all very delicious! Gotta say, I was happily surprised... I underestimated the quality of food at Lebowski's. And the service was prompt and friendly as well. A great spot in Dilworth to chill out at night and a speedy place to go for lunch as well - props to Lebowski's.

BycYp8KwvjvGjDRi5Eiu7w.text: Their wings are AMAZING. The service is always great. A perfect place to watch the games while enjoying some good food. They certainly hold down buffalo ny! And again, their wings are amazing!

K1AHXi-RyzKWccMp3uZgVg.text: I've enjoyed Lebowski's for almost 10 years. Great atmosphere for a sporting event or just hanging out with friends.   Nice beer selection. Pretty much the whole menu from sandwiches to salads are tasty.  The outdoor patio is nice for some fresh air.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. August 2016 - Great place to eat, socialize and watch games. Everything on the menu is awesome ! Employees are very nice! KJM

XZdyklpmWG2Wa-CCfREwjw.text: A True neighborhood bar. They serve some of the best wings in town, try the bee stringer flavor.

CEn9FyBmLku68t7BjtaLxA.text: I've had the nor'easter &  the crispy chicken sandwich, both with the garlic fries. The food is great, specifically the Garlic fries. I would drop by just for those. The restaurant is Small on the inside but there is patio seating. The parking is tight but I've never had to park outside the lot.

ZiaeJM-JtcM35GP79CUWCw.text: Always awesome! Kiel, Lizzy and Thomas treat you like family, even if it's your first time at Lebowskis!   Best wings and drinks in Charlotte!   Become a regular after one visit and you'll understand.   SERIOUSLY!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

a-c_y4Rhav0bcQlAksWtHQ.text: We're from Buffalo. Not impressed at all with food. Wings just OK. Fish fry not up to par with original "Friday Fish Fry" found in Buffalo. Weck slider just OK. Garlic fries good. Biggest disappointment was that wings were ordered "extra extra" crispy and they were. not even crispy.  Won't be back.

V-LTaRHEnzDjg8xvIc9sdA.text: The fish fry. The wings. The burgers. It's all so good and so hard to choose. Hands down the best bar food in Charlotte. Oh and the beer selection is laden with local favorites.

TFrhOLCCiMrFcuEp5hvDIg.text: Went for lunch and it sucked.  Food was bad - I guess you have to be from Buffalo to like this stuff.  Was charged extra for a side that neither the menu nor the waiter said I would be charged for.  Then to top it off the lousy waiter stiffed me.  To fix it management wanted to give me credit for the amount the waiter stiffed me on my next visit - yeh, like I am coming back here.  Proper thing to do would have been to credit me the side charge and the entire tip amount and put it on my credit card - but I don't think they care.

uwq6BWfMUl9wFSgN5GwSEA.text: I LOVE this place! Stumbled upon them when I was reading Charlotte Agenda one day and I have to say I'm so happy that I tried them out! Best wings I've ever had in Charlotte. Been going here once a week for the past month now which is impressive!

GGsrhYO_qSCKqMmUshsXnA.text: This is one of my favorite bars in Charlotte, almost a dive bar but not really... The food here is great, and the service top notch. Good craft beer specials from the local breweries.  Lebowski's  has great wings and sandwiches alike. We are really fond of the Dilworth area.  Be sure to stop by.

RVZ8jqUCuhgowVng1T3twg.text: Found this spot on yelp, Lebowski's didn't disappoint. Everything was good and fresh. The service was friendly and fast. I would recommend and definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Chicken Sandwich
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kids meal cheeseburger slider with chips
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

2tw27Dwakroq2qpfwNtIlg.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a while! We decided to go one night and got sat right away. Restaurant isn't huge or fancy but that's ok because it's locally owned and operated. Our server was awesome! She answered all our questions and she was super friendly!!  I got the 6 wing meal with garlic fries and a weck slider. Wings were awesome. I got it in hot buffalo with a side of ranch. Garlic fries were awesome! Super crispy and not greasy at all! Weck slider was good. Perfect amount! My husband got the grilled chicken sandwich and rice and he really liked it but he really loved my wings. We had no leftovers! I can't wait to go back! I'm gonna get the same thing but try a different slider!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fat wings!!!
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combi-nation-hot buffalo wings and the haddock slider
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combi-nation-hot buffalo wings and a cheeseburger slider

onEwZzrbFRk1aJc8cSMbew.text: After my first time going to Lebowski's I can definitely say it will become my new staple wing place. Easily the best wings I've had in Charlotte to date. We order the garlic parm, stingers, and the sweet BBQ flavor (forgot the name) and they were all absolutely delicious. They are cooked to perfection and don't loose their crunchiness within the sauce. We also order the fried pickles and the garlic fire both of which were absolutely delicious also. 10/10 would recommend

I8MGtE63NTULdrGPwR0nkQ.text: It is what it looks like - a great place of beer, (excellent) bar/pub food, and hanging with fun, neighborhood people. I have been a number of times at all times of day - but mostly for lunch or evening during the week. Always excellent fare - especially the wings and burgers. I loved sitting outside recently - something I usually don't get to do. It is not pretentious and just does the simple things very well. Always kind and courteous and willing to give some great suggestions for drinks. Go and give it a try.

b-opa8hJ-l-spTwSjpvuOg.text: After nearly three years in Charlotte I finally made it to Lebowski's! And now I am kicking my self for waiting so long. The food was great! Good flavor, excellent portions, and reasonable price.it was a busy Friday night but the beer was cold while we waited. The Buffalo and western New York themed decor was awesome. The server was probably the best service I can remember in a really long time.. attentive, responsive and friendly! We will be back! Beef on Weck and wings!

BNYedLNJWMtdX5jQPcwibw.text: Lebowski s...... I have been visiting this place for more than 5 years now, is a local neighborhood place, that can beat any of the american food chain in Charlotte. The hamburgers and chicken wings are amazingly well prepared, don t despite other items in their menu. The crew is very friendly and they will make your eating experience a pleasant one. Totally recommended, if you want to  experience the local american flavors

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lebowski s burger
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing niagara nachos!!
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo chicken wings

TC4jlzuqwMPDNwnHk3HB2g.text: I've visited at least a dozen times this year.  I am giving them five stars.  The atmosphere is sports-bar like, but not crazy noisy or overwhelming and I have noticed it is very clean.  They also have a nice outdoor seating.  The staff who have served me, from the waiters to the food runners, have all been friendly and kind to our family.  They have great daily specials, including my favorite -- mystery beer, where you choose a type of beer (IPA, Pale Ale, Lager, etc) and they bring you one from that category.  As far as food, everything I have had has been wonderful and my wife agrees.  Usually places like this have one thing they are known for, but everything I have tried on the menu -- Greek salad, fried fish, sliders, french fries, and wings -- has been  exceptional.  Their wings, by the way, are easily the best in Charlotte and some of the best I've ever had in all my travels.

8SuoGpQ3RLdnvOzdVdSOlw.text: I went here for their wing special. I was not disappointed. I feel like usually for a wing special you can get the one that haven't sold all week and have been in the freezer. These tasted fresh and were a great size. I only did the 10 wings and a side of fried pickles  (to share) and I left full. I enjoy their mystery beer option for $3. It was great, the bartender ask what kind of beer that I liked and chose one based on that. I've gone to places where the mystery beer is usually a cheaper non craft beer or one that doesn't sell. I will be back.

FfR014pvpcqHoXIrWgBgkQ.text: Wings wings wings! I have to admit, Lebowski's has some of the best wings in Charlotte in my opinion. They are flash fried, but juicy and tender. A must order when you come here!   Also, order the Buffalo chicken wrap and you will be golden! Nothing special here, but they make some pretty good bar food, but beware (or not) this is a Buffalo Bills bar so don't plan on coming here to watch any other football games during the season. These fans are crazy fun so if you want a good time come to Lebowskis for a game- get a drink- and enjoy the show!!! And the food :-)

N0ohbtG3orTX-SjCGar54Q.text: This place has the best wings in Charlotte.  Beef on Weck and Haddock are also excellent

9dWrZFnZGFtU2CmSJvjzxw.text: Great wings! The food here is wonderful. My favorite side is the spot tops with dip (sweet potato tots) they are to die for!!!

3V-jX7jO6Ef-x5lOYB79_Q.text: Wow this food was really delicious. We shared wings for an app, that gold rush sauce... loved it.  I had the haddock fish fry with the garlic fries. My daughter had a classic cheeseburger which she enjoyed if you value the opinion of a 12 year old and my husband had the jerk turkey burger. I did not care very much for the coleslaw and the pasta salad was kind of bland but other than that a positive experience. Service was great. Will definitely go again.

SALvlfY9Y6eroq17BOayvQ.text: Cool restaurant, especially if you are from western NY or a Big Lebowski fan. Good sandwiches and appetizer selection. Tues is trivia and 1/2 price specialty drinks.

_MgWEtUzu9IbWF_0rnWV7Q.text: Lebowski's is the perfect local neighborhood joint if you want simple american food that is always delicious. This place has a nice atmosphere and felt very cozy. Our waitress was great and was very attentive. I got the wings since i had heard a lot about them and being from the north i was craving simple buffalo wings. They were perfect. Sometimes with buffalo wings they can end up being slimy but these had the perfect amount of the Mild Buffalo sauce to give them a kick but to not overwhelm me. While i was perfectly happy with the basket of 6 wings my dad opted for 10 and finished them all off. I guess it depends on how hungry you are and what you get for a side. While my dad got the garlic fries, which are DELICIOUS, i got the mac & cheese with pecan bacon, because bacon is everything. My mom went for the junior Haddock Fish fry which was amazing as well. Lebowski's is definitely on the top of my list now when i want some great all american food for a great price! YUM!

CO2TVJapg2_3IcJFnl1NZA.text: Good atmosphere, tasty food. This is a fun place to grab a bite to eat and watch a game or two. Decent drink specials - they do a Wednesday night beer roulette.

j5DLA0tn54zJD4Or9o9e3w.text: Lebowski's is a great neighborhood bar/grill with food that stands far above what these places normally serve.  The standout: Beef on Weck.  This Buffalo-based sandwich has yet to go national on a large scale, but, if this is a typical version, a French dip will never be the same.  Basically this is a warm roast beef sandwich whose highlight is the roll:  a salted kaiser roll with caraway seeds.  Possible toppings include traditional dip sauce, pure horseradish, creamy horseradish, mustard sauce etc.  They have many other interesting sandwiches but our short trip to Charlotte meant we couldn't sample them all.  However, we were able to order "slider" versions of their sandwiches which is basically 2 or 3 mini versions of their popular sandwiches.  All were excellent but the beef on weck make this a destination.

Lzg7YuoP1SDyg2S5lvBvhg.text: Great Neighborhood spot!  The chili is my favorite along with the great sandwiches.  Also, the Time magazine cover mirror in the ladies bathroom is hilarious.  The Dude Abides!

8s7fpjUpuQdUErGjaOi0gw.text: This is my favorite place to eat and drink while in Charlotte.     Always good food and great service. Wings are better than most elsewhere. Fish and chips is also excellent.    Great beer selection as well.

sB2lsfaIMaTWkb_5ioOMLQ.text: Ate at Lebowski's last night for the 2nd time ever. A small dining room with a small attached outdoor patio for outdoor dining. I enjoy how small the restaurant is, makes it feel like a local hang out and very chill.   Decor was a mix of the Big Lebowski and New Belgium brewery paraphernalia.  Drink special was $1 off draft, they had about 6 beers on draft. But they also offer 50+ craft & microbrews.  We started with the Niagra Street Nachos. These were pretty tasty!  I ordered "The Boss" Grilled Turkey Club for dinner with their delicious garlic fries!! The pimento cheese in this panini really makes it! My husband ordered the wings which he loved as well.  Overall a good experience at Lebowski's and we will back again to sample more fare.

9B6sKA_0dbBSXVXF8L9KKg.text: Just an update.  The wings are pretty good, but there are better in Charlotte.  I wish they had "hot, medium, or mild" like in WNY, but there is just "Buffalo style" plus three or four other flavors.  They didn't take 20 minutes, so that was good.  My guess is that they may have been baking them previously; it doesn't take more than 9 minute to deep fry chicken wings.  The fried pickles were awesome, as was the Sunday "breakfast/lunch" sandwich on Nova's bread.  Prices are very good too.

Ta-R-a_SVvZKL76u1drxJA.text: One of our favorite places in Charlotte. Been here about 10 times.  My wife loves the Weck - and has never been disappointed. She loves it. I've gotten the burgers and fish and they've always been good. We always pay a little extra to get the fries (worth it). The service has always been top notch.  Nice neighborhood feel with older and younger couples; families and folks just hanging out.  The parking lot is small and a little tricky. But that's the worst thing I can say. Everyone should try Lebowski's at least once.

9zjK2DwWSuVghtrBZyL-Ug.text: Very good sandwiches and excellent garlic fries. Super bartender and fun, cozy atmosphere.

jLZM9pFaCRIrG0K6InyIIA.text: Lebowski's is a very small neighborhood bar but the bar itself is actually pretty tiny. I have heard many people rave about their wings and I've tried them but I never understood what the big deal was really. I am sort of a wing snob so maybe that is why I was not impressed but I was hoping for something more "wow" like when I tried my wings at Lebowski's. Overall, their food is better than your average bar food and they have a large menu with interesting food items.   They have a pretty good beer selection and most are in the bottle. There is also a decent sized patio that sits right on East Blvd so there is plenty to watch while hanging out with your friends. The atmosphere is definitely casual and I'm pretty sure it's a good spot for the service industry crew to come after work later at night. The decor inside is a little quirky and eclectic. The staff is very friendly and the bartenders are pretty well known in the area so they're good people to introduce yourself to!   Lebowski's is a great place to go by yourself just to grab a bite or a beer and meet new friends or bring your own and play trivia or mingle around on the patio outside.

6POL_FuVLM6O2VpgjTlBQw.text: Great food & a decent beer menu. My only complaint would be they need more room but again that is part of the charm of the place.

zzd2lRwhjcDhvz3xcjflCw.text: Back to Lebowskis for beef on weck. Have to get the au jus to make it authentic. Great place. Good service. Good food.

0-GOmvGRa-duALaBvpUf8Q.text: My husband'a favorite place to eat. Great bar food, fast and friendly service, and easy on the wallet. They always have a great selection of draft beers and rotate the taps often.

UK-gU-bkPjXYUCHfdpiyTg.text: With a Buffalo theme, you know the wings should be good. The wings are as good as advertised, game days are fun, kids have fun options and the staff is always friendly and helpful.   This is one of a our favorite places to take the whole family, and even the dogs can hang out on the outdoor patio.   If you are in the mood for beer, wings and a Beef on 'Weck, you need to take your crew here...

hNCRVNy91VvpxuzKz15vhA.text: Try the "Havana" the best sandwich in Charlotte! Having a pickle allergy, I asked to remove the pickles. Their service was on point, and I was 100% satisfied! Amy, one of the ladies who took care of me, was welcoming and friendly!

NTALx6f5niIjZIyaSU9vfQ.text: Not sure how many times I have been here..too many to count.   Never once was the food off or the service bad.   Amazing bar food in a relaxed atmosphere that I highly recommend.  The meatloaf dish is out of this world!

WJoAaDAov0ly4J72oNS4Cw.text: Deliciolus food and hilarious Lebowski references, I love this place,  The mirror in the men's bathroom is one of the greatest things ever.  The burgers are some of the best in the city becasue you can get them medium rare.  The wings are some of the best I've ever had and they are a nice size also.  Love this joint.  (very proud of myself for not using any quotes from Lebowski in my review)

INq6kDHf-s0BPkiR-cyA4A.text: My husband loves this place because he is from buffalo and they have all the Buffalo food favorites. Walking distance to our house so our dog loves to sit on the patio and they bring her a bowl of water. BBQ Mac and wrap is so delicious!! Great little neighborhood hang out!

xAAdPnG-PbutwGzP0xRotg.text: Spent the Holidays in the 716 (Buffalo, NY) last month and for some strange reason had a taste for wings. Mind you, we likely enjoyed this Western New York delicacy at least 5 times during late December but still a lite spicy snack was in order.   We ordered a couple of drinks and a double order of wings medium with a side of hot sauce. The server was prompt, pleasant and recognized us from earlier visits. It's nice to enter an eatery and be made to feel like old friends. Being a slow Monday evening, our wings were served in short order exactly as ordered.    Our wings were as meaty, spicy and flavorful as any wing I've ever consumed in WNY. And the friendly atmosphere makes Lebowski's a great place to meet friends, enjoy an adult beverage or two and sample some great wings. You'll find a rather diverse menu to choose from but don't miss the opportunity to try some of the best wings in town!

y5J4MXZ2vMAMEvlubsHE0A.text: Ate here last night! We have been coming for years and as usual the Beef on Weck was perfect. I had the weekend special with the Haddock. It was perfection. I missed my usual Fredonia Dip, but there is always the next time. My husband got the same thing he always does, the meatloaf with its huge portions. Service was quick and efficient. I cannotwaitto come back. The weather made it even better in the low 70's so we sat on the patio.
