BniuIMMAgi1c3ZGLgOUVzA.text: Lebowskis is known for there wings but I like their burgers. I ordered a medium burger and got a medium well burger. Ok. I can handle that. It was also a little salty, but I can handle that too. My biggest beef with lebowskis is this. We chose to sit outside, because inside didn't have room for a table for 5. They don't have a sctrict enough policy on dogs. There where 3 dogs in this area and all of them where  barking and being very Annoying. They offered water bowls so there was a dog 2 feet away from us sloppily drinking water and shaking water everywhere. It is pretty gross. I mean this doesn't change my rating. They are still really good. But the dogs where a nuisance to everybody who didn't have the dog. And then parking. ABHORENT parking. There are about 15 spaces and only one exit/entrance that has parallel parking where another lane would go. So it is just one lane in and out. The service was great and the food was pretty good too. Im not saying I wouldn't return, but I would return more often if these things where fixed eventually.

jauynDYtdis-xkKncBBAyg.text: My husband and I came here on Saturday with my parents as they were visitng from out of town. My dad wanted a nice chill bar atmosphere with good food. Never been here before but thought of Lebowski's. That description describes them pefectly.   The inside is decorated very laid back with lights stringing across the ceiling. They had about 10 beers on tap, mostly local. I ordered one of Sycamore's IPAs.  My husband and I decided to split the Jerk Veggie Burger with garlic fries and 6 wings (Stingers sauce). I couldnt even tell that the veggie burg wasn't meat!! (great sign for veggie and black bean burg lovers like myself). The pineapple and jerk sauce on the burger were a perfect combo. Came with tons of fries! I only had one bite of the wings, but based on how fast my husband ate them, they had to have been amazing. I thought the bite I had was well sauced. My parents split the french dip sandwich and some chicken fingers.   Great night. My parents loved the food and we were excited to have checked out this great neighborhood-like bar!

k3URc_LfbEPAZypXzKq2cA.text: OMG I am embarrassed about my 2011 self that gave this place a 3-star review?!?  Usually now-a-days when I am thinking of what to go eat, Lebowski's is at the top of my list.  I apologize... maybe I gave it a lower star rating so that I would keep this place as my own little secret.  Just as a "downer" note, the parking lot in back does tend to get a bit crowded, but if you can walk to this spot, its ideal and you don't have to play bumper cars with the folks out back.  Everything else about this place is great!  Servers are super nice and top-notch.  Even when this place is super busy and they are running around like crazy, they make sure you got everything you need and are enjoying your experience.  Must-do's in this place:  garlic fries, beef on weck sandwhich (if you are into meat), WINGS!, and checking out the cool Lebowski artwork adoring the walls.

4zZE8C1BF1vAdxWO8n2eTQ.text: I liked the atmosphere here when I visited. I didn't have any issues finding parking, the wait wasn't too bad and the wings were pretty good. Not my favorite spot for wings, but they're definitely very good. I plan on visiting again and trying something else.

8HkiEf3RHrjDCQ3JAWqCpg.text: The only reason they don't have 5 stars is because I'm a hard core dolphins fan and didn't realize how serious of a bills fan stop this was.   First off, the Chilli Mac n Cheese alone makes it worth stopping here. Unique local beer options at a pretty reasonable price.   The roast beef sandwich dipped in the au jus sauce and horsey sauce was amazing! So tender and the wek bun soft and warm.   The haddock has such a good flavor to it and the perfect amount of crispy.

oNI-QNmBlDs96q6oBND6OA.text: Great place. After our meeting @ C3-Lab we thought we'd check out some apps and a beer. We picked this place out and we're glad we did. They have a $3 "mystery" beers special and you can either go "complete mystery" or you can go for a "style mystery" - like "lager." I scored with a Great Lakes Porter and Char got a Blue Moon Wheat Beer. Then we ordered the 10 piece wings with a side of regular fries (next time - garlic fries). We had the "Stinger" sauce on the wings and they were just the right balance of sweet and spicy for us and the fries were fabulous! All of this for $19.25 plus tip! We'll definitely be back.

pSPAhXxL0YVfdD7glj_mDg.text: It is pretty hard not to be a fan of Lebowski's.  I mean it really is the perfect "neighborhood" grill.  Great atmosphere, low key, lots of options, affordable prices, great location, etc.  You really can't go wrong.  We had a party of 10 on a Saturday night and we were seated quickly, served promptly and efficiently.  We started with the fried pickles which were okay but a little too salty.  The ranch dressing was yummy though.  Everyone got something different...some burgers, some wraps, some salad, some wings, etc.  I tried the veggie burger in a pita wrap and it was great!  The sweet potato tots with honey butter dip were amazing.  It is pretty hard to go wrong with that but they really were excellent.  We weren't offered dessert so I have no idea if they have a good dessert menu but everything else hit the spot.  The pimento cheeseburger was a crowd favorite as well.  Truly there is something for everyone, healthy or greasy.  Great spot to catch a game, have a low key date night or to bring a group of friends.  I'll be back!!

RDBDWmTpuhv5H_mMfA0qYQ.text: Gave it another shot after receiving poor service one day and I'm thinking it was just a bad day. Service was much better. The food was good as always.   Love their garlic fries and beef in a Weck. Their buffalo chicken wrap is also great.  The atmosphere is family friend with a neighborhood appeal. Great place for lunch or casual  dinner.

kKhb2NRzNOK0UTrGTfdNfQ.text: I don't know why I wasn't expecting much considering the raving reviews, but this place really made an impression on me! It's definitely a cozy neighborhood bar type of place. The waitress was very friendly as was everyone on the staff.   We started with the wings for an appetizer and our waitress suggested getting the "gold rush" flavor. It was like a mustard based sauce with some heat to it. They were delicious! I would recommend the gold rush wings to anyone. For dinner I had the meatloaf and it was very tasty. The gravy had lots of great flavor and it was a ton of food. My only negative was that the veggies were too oily. My lips were coated in oil. Other than that very good. My husband got the beef of weck sandwich and it was ok. I didn't prefer it because the bun was covered in rye, but the beef was ok. Overall, I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meatloaf

qdx5oQNLRIupbEZYAjFi1Q.text: I'm a buffalonian so of course I cannot rate this place any less than a 5! Makes me feel right at home from the atmosphere to the food. Wings were pretty good for the south. I am very picky and could've been a little more crispy but the best I've had in Charlotte so far! I also had the beef on week slider. This was pretty good again for being in the south I'm just amazed at all they have it and obviously have had better in buffalo but I will take what I can get. For those that haven't had buffalo food this comes in a pretty good second! The service was also fantastic. I will say one bartender for a completely packed out place makes you worried but she was super attentive and did not make you wait for anything! Will 100% be back to this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

twTuT7ToyWzC7qh-09sTDw.text: Excellent spot for lunch. Lebowski burger and Wooden Robot Overachiever pale ale are an awesome combination.

LxEkrUemHIic-Ra9pn0HOg.text: We stopped here on a whim yesterday after my sons music class and boy am I glad we did!  Lebowski's would certainly make "The Dude" proud.  Laid back atmosphere with killer food.  Next time I'm wearing my robe...  Loved the Christmas lights lining the ceiling and carpet throughout the restaurant.  I ended up getting the Dixie Style burger adding Pimento cheese and a side of Mac and Cheese with Pecan Bacon.  Even though the burger wasn't the best I've had in Charlotte it was still really good.  The Pimento Cheese worked really well with the chili (how could it not?).  The Mac and Cheese was also really good - some of the best I've had.  The noodles were cooked just right (al dente) and the bacon to cheese ratio was just right.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dixie burger with pimento cheese coupled with pecan bacon Mac and cheese!

nZQ0H8SOeqPLbuaHuzCzvA.text: Love this place! The turkey burger with pimento cheese is the best, the patio is cozy, and it's a nice walk from Freedom Park. Also can't beat their martini deals!

NnexHApn0Om74qSeGdoduQ.text: This tiny little eatery makes up in taste what it lacks in service. The food is worth the trip folks. I got a trio platter and tried the haddock, beef on weck, and the wings. The beef on weck is the clear winner here. What awesome flavor! They have great outdoor seating and allow dogs on the patio. The menu looks great, so I'm sure to be back to try something else (or just eat another beef on weck).

QAfypVx-QXfjKyi0f9dRiA.text: Went to Lebowski's for the first time last Friday. We were on the hunt for some good wings. We arrived a bit before the dinner rush (just after happy hour ended) and did not wait long for a table. The atmosphere inside Lebowski's reminds of my favorite neighborhood bar from Ft. Lauderdale; it looked to be filled with local regulars enjoying the end of their week.   Ordered the medium buffalo wings for an appetizer and they were the best part of our meal! I would like to try some of their other flavors next time. I ordered the two slider meal with the buffalo chicken sandwich and the cheeseburger, garlic fries as my side. The fries were amazing.   The sliders were much smaller than the waitress made them out to be (I had asked her how big they were). Normally a slider meal will come with 3-4 sliders at that size, but this one only had 2. For $3 more I could have ordered another slider, but still $10 for 3 small mediocre-tasting sliders is a bit much.   Our waitress was attentive and our beers were refilled in a timely manner. I would go back to try other wing flavors and for the fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lebowski&#39;s medium Buffalo style wings with celery and ranch.

C3gmQAKF33xX1v2SiKry8g.text: Yeah, well, you know, here's just, like, my opinion, man.  Lebowski's is the type of place that really know how to tie a beef on weck together.  From the garlic fries to the jerk burger, this place nails their food.    This is a great place to kick back and watch a game and put down a couple White Russians or beers.  Decorated with a hommage to Buffalo sports teams and The Big Lebowski, it's tough not to love this place.    The service is quick and friendly without helicoptering.  I'll be back!  Try:  The garlic fries as your side

BnjQ42AKQcK6xHIFwO13Cw.text: Hands down my favorite place on East Blvd (walking distance from my place) to grab great food and drinks with friends. The only bad thing I would say is, don't expect them to be able to accommodate large crowds without a reservation. But that's it! Best chicken wings and fries!

y4O1HFAXdH_1zDy6de-bEA.text: I like Lebowski's.  A casual venue with a neighborhood feel to it.  I have never had a bad meal in the 10+ times I have been there.  Service is pleasant and courteous.  Food is a little better than what you would expect.  What is not to like?  But where is the kielbasa?

ud1pHBmeqV-Bszf-0Q_Yvg.text: I had lunch at Lebowski's on a Saturday.  I got there around 11:30 am and the place wasn't too full yet.  I had this on my list to try and the recent burger battle in the Observer had gotten me in the mood to try out some of the best burger spots.  I ordered a cheeseburger with pepper jack and the standard setup.  It comes with chips, but I opted for the fries for an extra $0.99.  The had a nice list of beers and I went with and OMB Copper.  My food & beer made it out pretty quickly.  When the server brought my food he also brought ketchup & mustard.  The ketchup was cold from the fridge, which I like, but that is unusual.  So a plus for cold ketchup.  The burger was done medium and was juicy.  The lettuce and tomato were fresh.  The fries were crisp on the outside and creamy soft on the inside.  Overall a very nice burger an fries.  The best in Charlotte?  This was my first stop at a burger place so that remains to be seen.  The servers did a good job of helping each other.  Which was good because my server was "getting her butt kicked," as she put it when she checked back on me once.  I had to wait quite a while for my check and for her to run my credit card.   It was busy, but no where near being swamped.  That was unfortunate and I hope she was having a bad day.  The food was a 4 the service was a 2 so I have to give them 3 stars.  I will try Lebowski's again just to see if that was a bad day or par for the course.

doV-DBoAfuuCcyv3ytgZFA.text: I eat here a few times a week. The staff is very friendly and the service is great. All of their dishes are amazing. If its your first time eating here go with their jerk Burger and garlic fries!

46AlWi562ryZM5BTV9xzsA.text: I wasn't sure what to expect but we decided to check it out while in the neighborhood. Simply put, we'll be back for sure. The Lebowski Burger is the ticket and isn't as unhealthy as it sounds. I was expecting a pound of mess but it was delicious. The bun is great!

CIJVnKxfMFf4vbKfawJK9w.text: As a Buffalonian, it was amazing to see everything that makes me think of Buffalo, distilled down into a sports bar. Made me feel at home. Chicken wings are available everywhere, but getting beef on 'weck is rare. Got an order, it was delicious! Definitely stopping by next time I'm in town.

a4Dqq4G34Xj58UQ53kSulA.text: Pros: Great wings Great beef on Weck (best in Charlotte)  Cons: Bad parking The restaurant really needs to be updated, but I guess that's some of its charm.  Awful service. We waited almost 45 minutes before we got our sandwiches. They charge extra for au jus, which is just weird to me!  For Buffalo food, this place is great.

aawabCZV0Q1kz6w8MDRzOg.text: We were out of town and needed a bar that was playing the Buffalo Bills football game. We came across this one and got there a little after the game started. It was wall to wall people standing room only while we waited for a table to open up. The drinks were reasonable and the food was great. Ate and drank well while watching the game. The serve did an awesome job making sure we had everything we needed even though it was busy. They gave you tickets if you hat bills gear on to win prizes from the restaurant during half time which is a great perk. The fried pickles were crispy and perfectly seasoned. The comb-nation is a great mix of 2 favorites 6 wings and a slider. The slider-nation is if you cant just pick 1 slider because they offer so many great ones. The greek chicken pita was packed with chicken and the spotted puffs were tasty too. For the price you can't go wrong with a good meal and the atmosphere adds to greatness of this restaurant.

TX9weWvTx144b2xf8Y3l9w.text: If you wanna feel like a local, visit Lebowski's.  Not to say that this is a True "locals" spot, because it's really not, but it just feels that way. Some nights it feels like you're on an episode of Cheers, where everybody knows your name, although it may be your first time stopping in. Even with their lit up sign prominently displayed close to East Blvd., Lebowski's can be extremely easy to miss. It's not a big place, but it's got big heart and character.  The wings...don't miss out on these wings. I have had the wings here at least 20 times and they never mess them up. Their sauces are phenomenal and every wing is cooked to perfection. With all of the Buffalo, NY decor and considering they used to make the pilgrimage up to Buffalo to participate in their annual wing competition, Lebowski's knows wings.   Other notable items: burgers, any of the sandwiches, fries, and of course the infamous chili-mac. I have never dabbled with their entrees except for the smothered chicken, but I'm sure they offer some good dishes in this area. The drinks are pretty standard. If it's artfully crafted cocktails you're after, think again, but if you want a good moscow mule you're in luck. Their draft beer selection is limited, but is always made up of at least 2 or 3 solid choices.  The service is typically solid and would meet most people's standards. It's a small venue, so it's hard for your table to be forgotten. Prices are fair; nothing too crazy here. If you are in the mood to go somewhere casual for a damn good sandwich, visit Lebowski's. For everything that it is, it's done extremely well without trying too hard...a solid 4.5/5.

LvoNjqxj_qJuKC-5N2q-Gg.text: Lebowski's is definitely a neighborhood place to grab a bite to eat and wash it down with alcohol. Thankfully it's walking distance from the hospital so my brother and I made our way there several times, one for lunch and another for dinner. It's one of his favorite places in the area.   Parking can be a challenge since the lot is small and parking hard to come by in the immediate vicinity on East Blvd. it also gets very crowded here. We opted to sit in the outdoor patio out front even when it was a little chilly since the inside is pretty cramped. Even though they have heat lamps outside we were told they can't use them since it's some sort of fire hazard. No biggie, I'm from Chicago so it didn't bother me. I preferred sitting outside since the inside smells a little like a wet damp cloth.  Both the hostess and staff are so friendly. Our server was kind enough to card us, which happened to be a few days after my birthday, bless her soul. Obviously I had to have a White Russian from their drink menu dedicated just to The Dude's quintessential drink. Both The Stranger and The Lebowski Caucasian hit the spot.  We tried the Trio Dip Platter which came with Spinach-Artichoke, Pimento Cheese, and Hummus, along with a good portion of pita points, crostini, and tortilla chips for dipping. It's a great way to start a meal and perfect for sharing since it can appeal to a variety of tastes. For entrees I had The Fredonia with the 'Weck (Kosher salt and caraway seeds) added to the grilled panini bread. It was so good. The roast beef and provolone with the accompany au ju was au so juicy. The 'Weck elevated it to the next level. Just the taste and crunch from the seeds added to the flavor land. texture profile. Also upped my side order to the garlic fries. They were good but not as crispy as I'd hoped. Brother had the Maude's Meatloaf which he's had before and said was great.  We went back for wing night during the week. The Garlic-Parm wings were great. The garlic fries were better this time around. Looking forward to the next visit when I'm back in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Fredonia with &#39;Weck and Garlic Fries
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trio Dip Platter with The Stranger and the Bunnie Toes White Russsians
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Fredonia with &#39;Weck and Garlic Fries

IgcrhlXOQJZiIXiLB-4-aA.text: Where have I been? I Lebowski's is now one of my favorite places to grab a bite! I've heard a lot about them and seen them on east blvd but this is my 1st time eating there and I must say the wings are amazing and my chicken sandwich was a pleasant surprise and my wife fell in love with the cilantro lime salad dressing! I'm telling everyone I know!

nNZp1BZYLevtl4cpbZz9XA.text: As the name says, it is indeed your neighborhood grill. The wait time wasn't long on a Friday evening and the place even though looks small has enough tables for a lot of people. Stepping inside you already get a feeling of a friendly make-yourself-at-home atmosphere and not like a chain restaurant. It is one of those places where you could order a drink and a meal, get nostalgic and talk for hours with your friends. Our waitress was friendly but did seem a bit anxious about getting orders right. I got the burger with a side of homemade chilli. The turn around time was quick and the burger tasted okay but not the best. I may have to come back here and try out a different dish. The restaurant is laid back and friendly, yes I would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smothered Chicken with sautéed mushrooms and mashed potatoes
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

Kj5s9pK0P-tDv75Gbj-8ew.text: Been here several times and my wife even more and I can't believe I have not gotten around to writing a review till today.  It's a great place with a western NY twist on things. Server told us the owner was from Buffalo which explains all of the Buffalo Bills flags and Western NY School pennants.  We drove down right after Church. We were originally looking for another restaurant and we could not find it, decided to go with what we knew was good.  Walked in about 11:30 and basically had the place to ourselves but that changed quickly.  Our server was very attentive. My wife ordered Unsweet tea which I questioned how sweet the sweet tea was. She brought me a sample and it was too sweet so she ended up mixing it half and half.and she did that throughout the lunch.  My wife order the Smothered Chicken which she has ordered before and she liked it.  I had the Fredonia.  Starts out as a French Dip but time you put it on a Weck Rolls with Caraway Seeds and horseradish it's closer to a kimmelweck which make since considering the Buffalo Connection.  Excellent choice since that is one of my favorites.  I actually glad we could not find that restaurant because lunch today was great and I finally got a changed to write a review of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beautiful Bar
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo  memorabilia

7G2oeARCspGup37b18RDPw.text: Upstate NY native, saw this place on Yelp and decided I had to give it a try. The atmosphere itself transports you back to New York, it has that same feel with the sports memorabilia and friendly faces. The hot wings here are top notch, nothing like the southern take on NY wings- these are legit. You can tell by the buffalo sauce alone that they know what they are doing with the wings.   My only constructive criticism would be with the fried fish. As yummy was the wings were, the fish had left me wanting more flavors. I felt as though it was fried far too long and lost most of its natural flavor as my fish tasted like breading instead of haddock.   Overall, we would return here to get that feeling of being home again. Yummy brews and more wings are going to be my order next time- see you guys soon.

8D8pFomP9AIhb8vqSb5nzA.text: Always love this place..i have yet to have a bad meal yet..i come here at least once a month it is on my once a month restaraunt circuit...the Kenmore does not disappoint at all with paddock and world class chicken wings...

ZUpWe0eLZAvRA2JoDCKKeQ.text: Charlotte has some very heavy competition when it comes to wings.  Go ahead and Google "Best wings in Charlotte", and most every site will have Lebowski's listed towards the top.   In my quest to hit every wing joint in CLT, I finally found myself on that side of town.   I wanted to see if the hype was real, I wanted to confirm what other Yelp reviewers had confirmed, that this was one of the Wing Mecca's of CLT.     So 3 star is for service, both my wife and my orders came out wrong and getting the server back to rectify the issue was a chore.  They were not that busy, so I am a little confused as to where the server vanished too.    My wife ordered the Buffalo Chicken wrap, but  instead of Buffalo sauce, she asked for the Stinger sauce (sweet heat) - the dish came out with neither sauces.  Also, why is there an up charge on this dish for fries?   Chips suck.  $1.29 up-charge is ridiculous.   Kudos to them for having a Yelp check-in offer that covers the cost.   But really, chips?    My gripe is I ordered wings with blue cheese and it was served with no blue cheese.   I know right?  Come on......I also ordered my fries tossed in the Garlic-Parm dry rub, that was missed too.     I went with the Buffalo Trifecta.......  But I really was here for Wings!!!!!  Okay, better than average.   Are they top ten, possible.   Are they top five, I could make a pretty strong argument that there are better wing spots.   But, in my view, as a True wing connoisseur, I find it baffling that they only offer six flavors.  Maybe they feel they have "dialed in" the basic flavors?   I dunno.  I went with the Garlic-Parm.   The dry rub was excellent, the wings perfectly cooked, not over crispy.     Just to confirm, the WINGS ARE EXCELLENT.   It was just not as earth shattering, to die for - I gotta drive all the way back to this spot to get my wing-on perfection.  A few other random comments for you, if you even read this far down:  The Haddock fish is fabulous, I would go there again and get this as a main dish.   Many reviewers have Yelped about the Haddock, my stamp of approval, white flaky with a perfectly lightly battered breading that is not fishy tasting one bit.   As of matter of fact, I was just in London for a week, and Lebowski's can hang with any of the Brits Fish n Chips.  Again, as many of the Yelpers commented, the Beef on Weck was tasteless.   I found it ultra bland.  There are better choices on the menu, just saying.  French fries are very good.  Ultra crispy.   Yum...   Great choice of local craft beers, six taps with two rotating.  It is definitely a cool, really great place to relax with friends.

LmLzeQvALT4bIXCNrunBhA.text: My boss takes our team out to lunch once a month and this month I suggested Lebowski's. The menu seemed to have a good variety of food for everyone to enjoy. Also, I was a tad selfish and wanted to come here because the reviews of the wings are A++.   The parking lot is small, so if you drive a large vehicle I would suggest going somewhere else for parking during high peak times. The building is small but the inside was very clean for a pub like restaurant!  First I ordered fried pickles. And oh my goodness were they tasty!! They came out super hot and I couldn't help but eat them up because they were so good! Definitely recommend them! A guy who isn't a big fan of pickles tried them and he liked them, with ranch though.   I ordered the 6 buffalo wings and garlic fries. If you get regular fries your doing it wrong. Other people got the gold rush sauce.. I tried one.. and I really wish I would've gotten that sauce! It is described as tangy-sweet but it wasn't super tangy. Oh how tasty it was!! Can't go wrong with classic buffalo though.   The other guys got the Lebowski burger and said it was amazing. I didn't try it but they said they would be back to get it again. Finally, a guy got the chocolate cake. Wow! I had two bites and it was very satisfying!!   I didn't catch our waiters name but he was bald and a really great waiter! Other waitress help with refilling our drinks. So ultimately all of the staff was nice, patient, and always ready to help!   All in all, I was thoroughly satisfied with my experience for lunch today! I can't wait to go back! Also all the other guys (8 of them) said the food was very delicious and even they would come back on their own!! And some of them live a good distance away! I recommend it for sure!!

kBH9m4ywdfEiqBoTRIpVJQ.text: There's nothing on the menu that isn't AMAZING I've been hooked on this place for 4 years now. Definitely my go-to when I'm craving some good southern comfort food. I feel like this is a secret local spot many people (outsiders) would never know about. Get the garlic fries!!! You won't be disappointed

txH4VKBkKjj9PKUMpqZXmA.text: The name is the best thing about this place. Unfortunately it didn't live up to the hype and I left disappointed and to eat another day. But it's been a few years since I was there.

5IK-QYzyGqDVv1iQGlxrrA.text: Great late-night option, or dinner!  Always our go to when we can't decide on dinner and it's 8 pm... the staff are friendly and attentive and all of the food is good.  Highly recommend the sweet potato tots as your side!  And they run great daily specials at the bar.   Also a great place to sit and watch a game!

ypBxoLQ1V2vm5JVCctN-xA.text: Lebowski's is known as being a True "Buffalo"/New York style restaurant.  It's not the biggest restaurant -- maybe 8 bar seats and 15-20 tables max? I've only had to wait a handful of times, though, so it works out. They are swamped on Sundays during football season as Buffalo Bills fans swarm the place.  Their wings are delicious, (Jeriyak is my favorite, following by gold rush and stringer sauce) they get 5 stars from me. All of their sides are also on point, including their garlic fries & their sweet potato tots.   Aside from their wings, I've had the Jerk Style Burger, fish tacos & buffalo chicken wrap. All are pretty decent, nothing out of this world. I definitely would recommend the wings over anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half gold rush &amp; half jeryaki -- just do it!

_0R57vpmc2l0GwgGi2nSDg.text: Visiting from CA , and these were the beat wings ive tried. Seasoning is great , very well cooked , soft and had a great taste. Definitely will come back. Oh and tacos are bomb.com

jqkjOkdoX1klR2iWAoccGw.text: Great late night dining place. I tried the buffalo style wings and my cousin ordered the fish tacos. Food was fresh and serviced fast. We enjoyed both of the dishes and will be returning to try other menu items.

666IkOQcq_P8kbGb4lcyfw.text: First time at Lebowski's for dinner Friday night. We opted for the Bang Bang cauliflower appetizer and it was so incredibly good! Then we got the sliders with garlic French fries. A really good meal! As an added bonus I got a coupon for checking in on the Yelp app! Huzzah!!

va_z3qBIcP_H7bpZ7fqg7w.text: Just a plain old super cool neighborhood sports bar. Terrific place for beer and ball games. Great bar food selection as well. My favorite wings in the Charlotte area. Especially the garlic parm dry rub. Definitely a neighborhood favorite.

wuAsSwJysRzJ7xK94e-x4w.text: Extremely friendly staff!  Excellent service and a great meal!  Who could ask for more?  My favorite meal is beef on weck w au jus...always tasty!

Ib8VKoxG9vXby_-loeY9Dg.text: Solid neighborhood bar and grill.  Nice mini patio and typical neighborhood bar inside.  Really good and pleasant wait and bar staff.  Good beer selection with about 10 regional craft beers on tap and another 20 bottles available.  As others have indicated they have good burgers and wings.  I like some of their low fat choices as well: veggie burger, turkey burger, and panini(s). The chicken florentine panini is as good as any sandwich that I have had in Charlotte. The current menu does not list the panini(s) clearly, but they usually can turn their veggie and turkey sandwich s (as well as some others) into an panini, which is excellent.  Parking is tight, but the next door retail locations close at 6:00 pm, and it is seems fine to park there after 6:30 pm.

QhhUAdYTI9OXXsJhQcwvvA.text: First... Let me just clear it up and say... the BEST Buffalo Wings in Charlotte, NC.  This is a great place to go for dinner, lunch, a quick bite, for bar setting, and for us... football.  This is owned by Buffalo NY natives and keeps True to the tradition of Buffalo.  I don't now of a better Beef on Weck in NC than at Lebowski's.    We were lucky last season when our Chicago Bears played a ton of 4pm games after the Bills.  If you are a Bills fan, there is no better place to be on a Sunday.    We also would recommend the Veggie Pita (which we get in a wrap vs the pita) and the burgers.  Monday is 2 burgers for $10 and 1/2 off wine.  Killer deal.  I believe Wednesday is 1/2 off wings.  Salads are also very good.  Becoming one of our very favorite bars in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ranchero Dog
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gold Rush Wings

yQPTd5MRsNVeOfi_VODJYg.text: Wings wings wings! Don't come here without trying the wings and I highly recommend the Gold Rush sauce. In addition to the wings we had the Beef on 'Weck, which was great but definitely need the au jus to go with it, and the tacos, which were plenty big for lunch. As a side item, try the Spot Tots which are sweet potato tots with a side of icing. Lastly, you can't go wrong with a wide array of beer. Our waitress was Brandy and she was the poster child for southern hospitality. Thanks Brandy!

67GF8cvYbvwsCyTPb042CA.text: I had the veggie burger and it was one of the best I have had since living in Charlotte. The garlic fries are delicious! I wish I could remember our waitresses name but she was amazing! Super friendly, fast and amazing service! I will definitely be back!

ELjtWQpVJFMlRbetYjkyJg.text: Bland neighborhood joint.  Redeeming value:  some Lebowski art prints on the wall.  Otherwise burgerish joint with poor ambience.   Needs to be either classier or divier to be interesting.

QbLY0VWTRna5uEIwP8YoHg.text: Not sure why I had never reviewed this place yet.  I've been going here for years.  It seems to be the place Dilworth area bartenders go to eat after their bars close for the night.   Even though I had lived in Upstate NY for a year I actually heard about Beef on Weck from here, not Buffalo.  Now I make sure to get it when I go back up there, but I like Lebowski's Beef on Weck and Lebowski Burger.   The place caters to the northern transplant crowd and is packed when the buffalo football and hockey teams are playing.   There is a full menu of white russian type drinks.  The daily specials are usually a good deal too.  My biggest issue is the parking lot is almost always a cluster.

_5BZtIXfokugXgLhN_H1bA.text: I have now been here 3 times (coincidentally only on Tuesday) before painting at Wine and Design about a block down the street.   We usually park over at Wine and Design and walk in order to not have to deal with the traffic on East Blvd. It is an easy walk and on sunny days the King of Pops stand is out and he can be an excellent after dinner treat.   I digress a little. We (I say we because it can be between 2 and 4 ladies) usually walk in around 5-5:15 and the place is consistently empty, beating the after work crowd. We are seated immediately and check out the drink menu.   On Tuesdays they have $5 Stoli vodka specials and assorted beer specials (this past time it was Fat Tire drafts for $3). However, True to form I always get the same thing Stoli orange and Sprite. **They do list $5 martinis on their website on Tuesdays - wrong - it is Thursday.**  I also have always gotten the Fredonia dip with the horsey sauce on the side because the taste of horseradish is very prevalent in the sauce. It basically a roast beef sandwich with au jus. But way more than "basic". The sandwich is grilled on a delicious bread on a panini maker and comes out fresh and hot. I've also partaken in their spot tots ( sweet potato tater tots) and their garlic fries. I prefer the garlic fries which they make fresh from the fryer every time we go.   The waitress is always very nice and very quick. The staff help each other out so everything you might need (extra sauce, silverware, napkins, etc.) is always at your fingertips. I don't really see us going anywhere else for dinner before painting, despite there being other options like Cantina 1511 and JJs Red Hots, this place is just that good.

_CgwjAWFTNvsGsVYSfjZcw.text: We used to be big fans of Township Grill where the family started in Charlotte but don't get to East Blvd all that often. We happened to be in the area last night and stopped in and are we glad that we did.  There was plenty of parking and easy access from the road.  We were greeted warmly like they really cared that we were there. The atmosphere was just right for a neighborhood bar and grill.   Our server was super.  Just the right mix of efficient professionalism and friendly helpfulness.  She helped us select a couple of our favorites from the old days; The beef on a weck and the fish fry.  They are every bit as good as they ever were and maybe even a bit better. The portions were perfect for an evening meal.  The price was very reasonable. It took us a while to find our old friends but we will be back soon.

mq3gD1ZA3XWjg9mHFa0uTw.text: Great place if you want a small tray or something home cooked, I highly suggest any of these writers or the macaroni and cheese dishes you can't go wrong

ugYzVFjhein1oFUoMLJ7vw.text: As a born and raised upstate New York girl, and a recent transplant to Charlotte, I was overjoyed when I heard about this place!  I went with my roommate, and introduced her to some of the food I grew up on!  I chose the "Taste of Buffalo" to get a taste of it all.  It included wings, a haddock fish fry (the only fish to fry in my opinion) and a beef on weck slider as well as french fries.  As an extremely picky wing eater, I have to say that the wings reminded me of home...I opted for just "hot" which is classic for Buffalo.  The fish was on the smaller side, but was tasty, and they have it every night, unlike at home (usually Fridays only).  The beef on weck was also delish.  Only downfall- we had a coupon but found out it was only valid on certain nights.  Lots of Buffalo Bills stuff inside....felt like home!    My rommate got some sort of sandwich, and also really enjoyed it.  There was a dip on the menu called "The Fredonia."  My sister went to school at Fredonia, so I took a picture of it on the menu and sent it to her!  She got a kick out of it for sure!  If you are an upstater, as a lot of we are in Charlotte, check it out, I don't think you will be disspointed!

ZQuawfT0-5LUWQZsuoz0FA.text: Best wings in Charlotte. I recently moved to this neighborhood from another part of Charlotte. After 15 years of being in Charlotte I have finally found a place that knows how to cook wings the right way. They are always on point. Oh and the garlic fries yea they are to die for. Love this place. And the best part is that they are a dog friendly business. Pups are welcome on the patio and the staff is great to them as well. Thanks for Being so awesome!

JSMUzL3zJh1nW_aiCT5S7Q.text: Here from out of state and looking for something new this was a great treat ! Went in for a easy dinner and left very pleased. Had the trio dip to start it was excellent. Good drink specials and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

jvB7kmRGlqbqOv5317h6ZQ.text: My wife and I wanted to try a different sports bar in town, mainly because it  was Game 4 of the NBA Finals... we chose this bar because we'd heard people talk about it and we passed it frequently. Parking was "interesting", but we figured it out and the wait time for a Friday evening was pretty good (about 15 minutes). But from that point on, it was a DISASTER; we waited close to 20 minutes before anyone came by to even give us water or utensils (while every table around us was clearly being served appropriately). Once someone actually took our drink order, the wait staff FINALLY came over and attempted to take our order; the server was very fake and aloof and came off with the "why are you here?" attitude (we did notice that we were the ONLY people of color in the bar at the time) To give some credit, the food order did arrive quickly and the food itself was fair overall, but the service and the experience was the worst I've experienced in quite some time and we will don't be going back ever again!! I ABSOLUTELY DO NOT RECOMMEND IT FOR ANYONE OF COLOR... the disrespect was blatant and unapologetic...

oDmhLC1yk3lWobbo9Fd8CA.text: Tuesday night is always hopping with trivia. If you want to bring a group for trivia you may want to call ahead so you can make sure to get a table big enough. First place is $30 and the winners of each round get 4 beers.  My favorite is the chicken tenders tossed in "stingers" sauce but pretty much anything on the eclectic menu is great. Haven't found anything that I've been remotely disappointed in after coming almost once a week for a year.

59OBfOBALKZSDc9QC2C_zA.text: One of the better local bar/food combo places you'll find in Charlotte.  Not pretensions, just a good spot.  If you go for trivia on Tuesdays, be sure to reserve a table.

yFCG0r4gUYjgf4kMeMAh3g.text: Best around for a friendly low key night out.  Great service, very solid bar food, and reasonable prices.  Great wings, fried fish and nachos.   Decent selection and a late night menu after 10pm.

d77-d6ltvMUGmuA18U7Ung.text: Great place to watch a game, grab some grub, hang with friends and play trivia. The wings are solid and the garlic fries are great. Make sure to ask them about their daily drink specials. This is considered the Charlotte Buffalo Bills bar for any Bills fans out there.

Zxba7zoxLWLAOZapmsbLFA.text: Lebowski's isn't really the type of place that I'd normally stop at, for a couple of reasons.  First and foremost, because I don't get down East Boulevard very often (though I should - more and more places are cropping up that make it interesting).  Secondly, because it's a smallish place that looks a bit more like a pub than a grill, and in my advancing years it's just not where I'd stop for a bite to eat, which is what I'm more after these days than a drink.  That out of the way, when we had an unofficial Yelp gathering the other evening, I'm glad that it was chosen to be at Lebowski's, or we might have missed this hidden gem.  The night started off right with the service.  Amy greeted us right away (well, after Dave S. and Joseph L, but they don't really count, as they aren't employees), introducing herself, asking our names and perhaps most impressively, using our names throughout the time we were there.  Not often that you see that happen these days.  Nicely done!  That was followed up by a creative menu, serving the aforementioned sliders so that you aren't cornered into a single choice that you might not like.  I chose the beef on weck, burger and pulled pork.  They arrived with an impressive array of condiments, but those were scarcely needed - the sliders stood well on their own.  The weck roll doesn't seem to be quite an authentic weck roll, but I'm not an expert, and it serves the purpose well enough.  I probably could have done with another order of sliders, but I saved the extra room for one of the several varieties of White Russians (hey - a place called Lebowski's, and you aren't going to order a White Russian?).  Altogether a pleasant experience, and I'm glad we made the choice.  Parking was also ample, which can be an issue in this area of town.  The only downside is that it's not a larger space (that, and for some I could see it being more bar-like may be an issue).  For our group neither was a problem, but I could see where one might be for others.  I also wish that I had ordered the garlic fries instead of the mac and cheese as a side.  Very tasty (I sampled someone else's)...

sn3_1x-KOHm6tIgJCpE_RQ.text: This place is amazing.  Atmosphere and wait staff are top notch.  The best part is, they are open late and the nighttime menu is excellent.  Try the spinach artichoke dip, and of course the garlic fries!

yHy0GcfWn6F8t3HO5UwBfg.text: Never knew I would like a sandwich so much! Food Tasted super fresh and the place has a simple and elegant ambience!

IeeVlAOVjedOp2JEGd3tbw.text: This has become our regular family grub pub. Small, movie- themed neighborhood bar and grill down the street from our apartment with something for everyone on the menu. Lots of TVs, and has covered outdoor seating for people watching and enjoying the upcoming fall weather. Our waitress was so friendly it was actually making me paranoid. She legit seemed concerned if we were happy or needed anything, which is a change from South Florida. Refills were spot on. Get the wings and the chili....dude!  This is also a great family friendly place, our 2 year old was given a small bucket of good quality crayons and a coloring kids menu that wasn't exclusively crap fried kid food.   Only downfall, parking is minimal, but not worth a penalty to the restaurant.

ockyrFaJcha6k1Sbe3qCIQ.text: Not bad, but not great. Husband had the bacon cheeseburger and it was cooked perfectly. Salad was fresh and green. My cheeseburger sliders were a bit dry, no extras (lettuce, tomato, onion, sauce, etc) - forgettable. Sweet potato tator tots were cooked correctly, but not much additional flavor to them to make them stand out. Service was excellent, hostess efficient and friendly. Restaurant was cold, so a bit uncomfortable. To be fair, the hostess tried to seat us at a high top table further in due to the cold, but we didn't want to "be on display" and asked to sit at a regular table. Pictures of other dishes on Yelp look good, so maybe I picked the outlier.

R2I3ZSsfNdTmDeloW9rngw.text: Good beer selection. Really good wings. Buffalo bar with Beef on Weck, haddock fish fry and great wings.

QOmFu-SMBXF0LNKEKzWBlw.text: Note to people that have expense reports!!!  They PRINT THE DETAIL OF THE CHECK ON EVERY CREDIT CARD RECEIPT COPY.  If you travel for work, you need to know this, AND I WISH I KNEW THIS BEFORE I ORDERED. I have never had this problem in any other restaurant, anywhere, and I travel weekly.   The place is cozy, and the menu selections are numerous.   Lots of TV's = good views from every seat in the place.   I had a beef on weck with added cheese and horseradish. I think it was called a Franciscan. I was pretty good, but I think I would order something else next time.   The Mac and Cheese with bacon was really good!  Beer selection is extensive, and red wine by the glass is 8 bucks, with several good choices.   The service was friendly, but it was pretty relaxed. If it was lunchtime, I would have dinged them for it, but it was just fine with me as I wanted to watch a few sporting events.   Next time I will try their wings, as other reviewers said they were great.

VDa5MtYLgfhEmaNuSOveFg.text: ...As some of you may know, I took a short hiatus from writing reviews.  This break was due to some negative feedback I had received from restaurant owners, but mostly because I was busy with work...  ANYWAYS, after much prodding (thanks Ben!) I'm BACK, and I'm back to close out 2013 with a slew of the best reviews from around the QC. What brought me back, you ask?  Simply put, THE DUDE, and the wings they serve up at Lebowski's...  Two buddies of mine had been encouraging me to give Lebowski's a try.  I was told Wednesday was the place to go because of their half-priced wing special on Wednesdays.  As I had this past Wednesday off from work, I decided this would be my virgin foray to Lebowski's.    Parking:  There is plenty of parking located behind Lebowski's.  I am not sure of the relationship between JJ's and Lebowski's, but you could also probably park on the JJ's side of the building as well.  No parking issues at all, which is always a plus.  Ambiance:  The first thing I noticed upon entering Lebowski's is the darkness.  Though I went there around lunch time this past Wednesday, the place felt dark and somewhat dreary to be honest.  One would think that with such connections to the Big Lebowski, it would be a bit more lively inside.    Service:  We were greeted by the one person that was working the entire bar.  She told my friend and I, we could seat ourselves where ever we wanted.  Our drink and food orders were taken fairly promptly.  Though our server probably had three to four other tables, her service was still very much on point.  Our drinks were refilled promptly, when we asked for an extra ranch, one was brought directly to us.  Food:  As I stated above, I came here on Wednesday, looking to sample the wings I had heard so much about.  So of course, I ordered a batch of 10 goldrush wings which did not disappoint.  The wings had that rare combination of being well-cooked yet still tender.  The meat on the bones was very tender, and fell off the bone with with every bite.  The wings were PERFECTLY sauced.  There's nothing worse than a dry wing!  The ranch was thick and cold, just as it should be.  My friend ordered the buffalo-style wings and was also satisfied with wings.   I've only been to Lebowski's once and I've only had one thing on the menu.  Nevertheless, the wings, and service were excellent and I'll be back.

_BIb0LnnGukSsF0rsWGSJw.text: I chose this "Small" restaurant while driving through the area.  Although on  Sundays most of the restaurants in the Queen city seem to remain close.   This Bar/Restaurant does not disappoint.  Even though this is a Bill's bar and I am not a Bill's fan we were welcomed with open arms and even offered food recommendations by the locals.  The wings are True to life Buffalo Wings.  I have all applause and no complaints.  The flavor was amazing.  The texture was amazing.  The time to table was amazing.  The wings were to the table in 3 mins.    We ordered the fried Haddock for our main which arrived moments after I grabbed the last wing.  It was among the best pieces of fried fish I have ever had to include 4 and 5 star restaurants.   I did the garlic fries as a side.  Again some of the best flavors you can get from deep fried potatoes.    I was able to sample the Cole Slaw and the roast beef sliders.  I was not impressed with the flavor of either as for me I have had better.  For me the wings, fish, and service make this place super amazing.  P.S.  if your driving through get some wings to go.  I did not and I wish I did.

xs-jgeMElvcR6fGXzXd2bA.text: My first time here and I heard the wings were amazing so I tried them along with a burger. Shockingly I finished both! Food was amazing and the service was great. I will definitely be returning

vElMZk05kpyLfUMmOlyOQA.text: Lebowski's is so yummy.  The atmosphere is cozy and charming. Great food and spirits too. The parking lot is a tight squeeze but you cannot have it all.   Extremely great location. Close to uptown without the fuss.

SZNnvAomeDGncrAD6Tg2LA.text: Great easy going neighborhood sports bar. Good local beer selection.

crmrjt_CYhvo3tv0e5ORjA.text: Incredible. Service was on point. Prices are perfect. Food was amazing. I can't be more impressed with a small business in a big city. Hand on heart, new favorite place.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Behind the bar.

NwgBIsGZKOkc_HlQj6cgUQ.text: I was a little let down based on the great reviews I had read before going. I had the Fredonia dip since the regular Weck sounded kinda plain. I thought it was a decent sandwich but definitely nothing special. My husband had The Boss sandwich and was totally not impressed. Also, the people who were seated next to us after we had been there for 20 minutes got their food 5 minutes before us. We waited a long time for mediocre food. Meh.

h5JJbsm-ppzdyTIBSKJccw.text: I've been curious to try Lebowski's after I heard raves about their garlic fries. Being Italian and a carboholic, I had to try them ASAP. I've passed by there before and seen a good number of people on the patio but when I went was surprised by how little the inside was. I could see this being a good bar too that's not too loud and where you don't have to keep shouting "What??!" to someone when trying to have a convo. The menu had a lot but nothing was really screaming out to me so  I got the Jerk style Gardenburger with garlic fries (I love how you can sub meatless or turkey in the burgers) and it was pretty tasty with attentive service. The garlic fries could've been more garlic-y as I like enough to keep the vamps away.  I hear they have an awesome happy hour from 4 to 6P each day so I would love to check that out as I love anything cheap. Edit anything cheap involving the sauce. I had a good experience but it's not one of those places where I would tell people they have to try. I would like to check it out again to see if will be more memorable.

KxzRMV-ZM7klcGjgo3biSg.text: I found this place while searching for a good wing place. I must say I'm impressed! The wings were really good they were hot just like I like them! The waitress was extremely nice and even gave me a free brew on the house. For 10 wings and fries came up to $13.95 and that's not bad. I don't stay far from the dilworth area and have seen this place on Yelp but never tried it. I'm so glad I did! I will definitely be back to try other items on the menu. Thanks Lebowskis for making my day after a long hard work day!

z0YMHdQZ5CAusLmFUw6K7g.text: I like it here...the salads are good & fresh.  The wings not bad and a very good Haddock!  This is a normal go to when I can't decide what I want, but want options.  The wait staff is pretty cool too.

Zm35rIMaBFRZiokaajh4jA.text: This restaurant was really good! It was my first time and I called in my order and Stephanie answered and I had no idea what I was getting but she was so patient and nice ! The food was amazing also! I will be eating there again!! The goldrush sauce is absolutely amazing and the customer service was awesome also! This is a great place to eat !

8jgCvSI3XfJ4o69VQwxZ9A.text: Interesting place, they have a whole section of the menu dedicated to speciality white russians. I had the Lebowski burger with garlic fries. Burger was fine overall with the exception of the grainy and somewhat off-putting  "queso sauce". Fries were really good, had that nice double fried crunch. Overall pretty standard fare from this neighborhood Buffalo bar.

mJA6ksox_btOxlQtqf0MZQ.text: Probably the best buffalo bar in Charlotte...didn't know there were so many. Had the Lebowski burger and the food, like buffalo sport teams, was mediocre.

PCAK8FMgmdWkeh-AuCkwSA.text: Dudes, Without a doubt, this is one of the best bar and grills I have ever been to. I should say I came here while in town for a conference and because I am a fan of the movie. However, it could have been a niche/theme restaurant only if it weren't for the great food and excellent service. The wings are great-I like them extra hot and these are not but they taste great. Sliders were wonderful. Beer selection proud and reasonably priced. A variety of White Russian specials (Caucasians) that were tasty too. The place is decorated with some original TBL themes art-some of which they were willing to sell. Amy was our server on both visits and she was one of the best servers I've ever had in a restaurant and went above and beyond for us. I would go back as a fan of the Dude if it wasn't good-but if they completely dropped the theme i would still be back any chance I got for the food and service. I just wish I lived closer.

I went on a Sunday night and there wasn't many customers but that was ok. Next time I come back to Charlotte I will have to stop again and hopefully it's a Friday or Saturday night

FbVAOlSzilNre-LlWsEILQ.text: Came here on a Saturday night for some wings! I was not disappointed. Did 10 wings, half stingers and half gold rush. Both flavors were good and the wings were crispy. We also got 3 sliders, buffalo chicken (which tasted really yummy dipped with ranch), cheeseburger (literally patty and cheese) and beef on 'weck (roast beef slider and you can get au jus).   They have daily drink specials. We went on Saturday and the choices were $2 Bud Lights and $4 well drinks.

VTvlXSPwXuNZ_D9JZrET2Q.text: Returning to this classic after entirely too long, I met a friend here for lunch today. Wow, it hasn't changed much since then. Perhaps a few more "Big Lebowski" trinkets from the movie (I liked the Lego "picture") and updated furniture.  I went right to the "The Lebowski Burger" which comes topped with sliced roast beef and queso on a 'Weck roll'. Swapping out the chips for fries, it was excellent. Lots of meat, of course. Drippy cheese. Fries were "steak fries" variety and seasoned. Tasty and firm for scooping ketchup.  Good selection of beers on tap.

ER4QQsZpaqVOhSHonQxpCA.text: I went to join friends for trivia night (on Tuesdays from 8-10pm). I ordered a cider on tap which was pretty good. It was a good experience. I didn't try any of the food only because I had just hand dinner elsewhere. Great atmosphere and great staff

J7_0pW95ozYtB0c1i0QDhw.text: Great neighborhood bar/restaurant. Cool theme, reasonably priced, and tasty. The service was prompt. Good spot for drinks after work with a bite to eat. That said, overall it may not be worth it if your drive is anything substantial.

ghoYJ0uCQoVTLsA0Pvb-fA.text: Been wanting to go to Lebowski's for a long time and finally made it there this weekend and boy am I glad I did. Great wings. The best I've had in Charlotte. Large menu with many great options to choose from. Very friendly and helpful staff. Will definitely return here for more wings.

dlDdC5EccB3v_WaEQof0JQ.text: A neighborhood bar which should be surprised given neighborhood is in the name. The location is great and the staff is friendly. The interior needs an update.   Overall the food is OK. It's traditional bar food so not a lot of healthy options.

F7W_O_jzX8wbn3u6EENQcA.text: My parents are from buffalo so I grew up knowing good wings and weck. This is the real deal. I'm in Charlotte for work and read about his on yelp. It's kind of in a neighborhood type location. Sitting on patio and people have dogs (and a cat!) in a relaxed venue with great food. The garlic fries were tasty. The roast beef on weck was truly delicious and the garlic parm wings were the perfect combo of flavor and crisp. If I lived here this is the kind of place my family would come and also order take out. As a side aren't cats usually uncomfortable in public? This cat here is clearly very happy. That's a five star review that stands out!!

JZedrskIoBUqT649y6hQqA.text: Despite the continual infusion/intrusion of trendy new restaurants all around it, Lebowski's Grill & Pub just continues to do what it does best, which is to serve up decent burgers and chicken wings. There's absolutely no pretense, inside or out, about this neighborhood favorite. Most people will either love or hate it. Its cramped interior defiantly shows its age and parking can be pain, which is why this suburbanite decided to go for an early lunch.  I tried the 10 count wings, half Buffalo style and half Stingers, for $10.79. They were tender, meaty and tasty as advertised. I followed those with their popular Jerk style burger, which was topped with pineapple and peppers. It only included chips but otherwise it was made with top quality Angus beef and served on an egg bun. It was tasty, but at $9, I would expect a little better side than slightly stale chips. My friend had the Supreme Burger, and although also good, we both agreed that we were biased after enjoying one of Charlotte's best burgers another historic bar and grill the day before.  Sanitation score was acceptable at 94.5 and the service was attentive and friendly. Fountain drinks at $2.29 each were filled regularly. Overall, we found the meal to be slightly better-than-average, but I admire it for what it is, a simple neighborhood bar that reflects pride of ownership. Although it's not on my Gotta Try list, I'd definitely stop by again if I were in the area for a burger or a brew.

The wings were kinda hard to me but the flavor was really good. If you check-in on Yelp you get one free side with a purchase of a sandwich. I would eat here again

1o8_OmHFAMU1afHq7xgvOw.text: I've been to Lebowski's only one time since I moved to Charlotte. It was GREAT.   We were looking around the ole internets for some good trivia in the area and we found Lebowski's consistently making people's lists towards the top of the ranks. We decided to give it a shot.  We called ahead to get a reservation on Tuesday night with no trouble at all. As soon as we got there, they cleared a table for our group and sat us no problem! The menu had a bunch of things that looked tasty, which is always nice because you can get something and still want to come back to try some other things! There were a few specials on drinks (beer under $3, $4 white Russians) and some on food, too.  I opted to go with the *award winning* wings and was not disappointed! They were great. Not too spicy, but sauced up enough and crunchy. I got a side of pasta salad and although I'm not a huge fan of olives, the pasta and peppers part was delicious.   On to the trivia! My friends and I from DC played a lot of trivia up there, and really wanted to find a good spot in Charlotte. We nailed it on our first try. I forgot the dude's name who does the questions and answers there, but he was fantastic. It went at a good pace, and didn't last way too long like I've seen some trivias before.   Bottom line, if you're looking for a good trivia outing and some good food to accompany, Lebowski's is your place!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Stingers&#34; delicious
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Refreshing pasta salad

mBAAWPA2Bt_4gGVr-u_ZQw.text: Great example of a local place where fabulous flavors and exceptional service comes together to create a beautiful marriage. We walked in 25 minutes before closing time on a Saturday night and were greeted with a smiling face and a positive attitude (remind you we walked in 25 mins before closing! Lol). Our host seated up and took our orders and remained attentive until our food arrived a few minutes later. Let me tell you the fish is amazing! The fries were crispy and delicious. The pimento cheese on the burger was to die for! Great great experience overall; I will definitely recommend to all my friends and family!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wine and dine baby
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sliders!

2ZGuxdWR1FmEF1i0JCSylw.text: I have now been to Lebowski's twice for trivia on Tuesday night and I've become a huge fan. It is really a great neighborhood bar and doesn't disappoint on food or drink specials. First time around I ordered the Haddock Fish Fry and was impressed at how delicious it was. The seasoned fries were delicious, the fried haddock was crunchy and flaky, and the homemade tartar sauce was just outstanding.  Big shout-out to the wings, which I got on my second visit. They really sauce them up and they are fried to perfection. The drink specials are great too, with $4 white russians every single day (and they are damn tasty) and $3 Fat Tire pints on Tuesdays.  This is a great establishment. Don't miss out on the awesome food and drink specials!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Haddock fish fry. Really impressive!

XWqVwzM6CBfyF-oU3--R2g.text: We had wanted to try a new place, as we do often, and this place was one of the best we've been to. Small neighborhood place, it is easy to see why the place is rated almost 5 stars!  Service was excellent.  Food was superb.  Prices were fair.  Drinks were top notch.  Great atmosphere, and plenty of privacy wherever you may sit.   I can't wait to go back and try something different. I had the burger and it was to die for. A definite must-go to place if you're in the area and hungry! This place will NOT disappoint you!

CCBaLC6Wjv_wjvNXvtoCNQ.text: What a great little place... this is a quintessential neighborhood bar, in one of my favorite areas of Charlotte nonetheless! I've been here a number of times and each time is great!  Yes, Lebowski's does have some of the best wings I've ever tried, it isn't just a claim. They are served with no frills, like everything else here, but that makes the food pop even more. The True highlight is the garlic fries... I could eat those for hours! I always make sure to stop by when in town.

qbn6rsdSvY3vN5vonroBZA.text: I came here for trivia night with my friends and had a blast! They do not have much seating, so I would recommend calling ahead to reserve a table to ensure that you can play/have no wait. They also have T.V.s if you are wanting to come here to watch a game.  The trivia is challenging but very fun! They have great drink specials as well. I ordered the $5 Titos special with bloody mary mix and it was very good.   The main reason I gave Lebowski's a five star is for their JAW DROPPING chicken tenders and garlic fries. Ask for them with their stinger sauce, it will CHANGE YOUR LIFE. I never thought I would think this highly of any chicken tenders personally, but these are fit for a King. They are cooked just right, very juicy and tender. The breading is perfect as well, not too much bread or too crispy/crunchy. The stinger sauce makes these chicken tenders even more incredible. It is a sweet and sour/buffalo/siracha blend mix (I think). It adds a depth of flavor which you can only dream of.   The garlic fries are also perfectly cooked and seasoned as well. Would highly recommend switching out the side for these.   Would definitely give this place a try if you haven't!

PA1A6zLD5XlCMX4dGAauyQ.text: Great restaurant atmosphere. Love the vibe and food. Multiple white Russian options, inspired by "The Dudes" favorite drink.

PTQAp8_AyEHS4vDNx1fgfg.text: Had the Wings (extra crispy , all drums) requested the sauce on the side. Mix up in the order but not a big deal. Wings were as advertised, very good Garlic fries were good, but couldn't tell the difference between them and the regular fries( yes I had both, I was on my fat boy)  Don't judge me.  Overall pretty good, wouldn't go back, the ambience wasn't for me, however the staff was great.

K7yCGt5igCT2pRqi7vdewQ.text: Swung in for a Saturday night dinner and the host had us seated in less than 10 mins. Quick peruse of the menu and decided to go with the "Buffalo Trifecta" and was not disappointed by the platter of 6 wings, a beef slider, and two pieces of white fish along with fries was more than enough to get my fill (and in reality could probs be split for two). The entire plate was good but will say the buffalo wings stood out as being exceptional to the rest.  2- Saturday is $2 BL bottles  which paired perfectly with the setting and dinner

h_RyBWIFwUY5W7NweFpu1w.text: Decent burgers and fries. We had a to go order so maybe not as good due to that but everything was average. The atmosphere looked good inside but obviously didn't stay.   Updated this to reflect 4, after a second visit. We decided to try it again because we were craving wings and they were said to have great wings and they were right. The wings were fantastic. We got the buffalo and gold rush and they were huge. If this was my first experience I would have said 5 stars but because if the take out order we had I split the difference.

xL-qQ7BI2NMChmUM1fkOVw.text: The Buffalo wings are the best I have ever had. My wife really liked them ad she is normally a mild eater.  Thay have just the right amount of fire to them.  I thought the parking was crazy but the food and beer was great.

y5tTMG2ub_yuSO05KYCYNQ.text: This place is absolutely the best! If you want the best wings in town, then this is the place for you. My husband and I were in the mood for chicken wings, so we decided to try Lebowski's. The place was crowded, so we sat in the parking lot and placed an order to go. We ordered 25 wings. They only allow you to get 3 type. We ordered the mild original, jerkiaki, and the carolina gold. The wings were cooked to perfection. The carolina gold were my favorite. I encourage any and all to try Lebowski's...you will not be disappointed.

I5wIpwGOCp61FTVrXdWtsg.text: Favorite restaurant in Charlotte!  Absolutely obsessed with this place.  Best wings ever (buffalo, extra crispy) and garlic fries - my order every time.  I won't order wings anywhere else.  I've had bites of other items and they're amazing too.  The Lebowski Caucasian is my favorite white russian on the menu.  I can't believe more people don't know about this place.

N1hS_9W3bU9-2ruHFf6nyw.text: I am embarrassed to admit I have never been to Lebwoski's...but, that is about to change. Last night we decided to check it out for dinner. After walking in all I could think about was the seafood/sushi restaurant that was in this same locations YEARS ago. So, with that in mind I was surprised how dark the restaurant was, and a lot more casual.  There are several TVs, a bar along the back wall and several tables throughout. But, the highlight is the outdoor patio. Have never been and heard great things about so many menu options we ordered a varity of items, including, wings, haddock, beef on weck, mashed potatoes and gravy and salad.  First off, the salad was simple, but very fresh. As for the wings, the best I have had in Charlotte. We got medium heat and it was perfect for my liking.  The haddock, OMG, loved it!  Great white fish with a light batter and a flavorful tartar sauce. My least favor item was the weck on beef. That may be because I am not a huge beef eater, but I thought it was just okay. And, they forgot our au jus so that may have helped. Overall great service, food and we will definitely be back.

FTB_l6Hhkn-7D34DmDg-Qw.text: One of my favorite bars in Charlotte. They have great specials and food. The staff is always very friendly and the bar has a very inviting feel to it.

ecgFcEKyN3JhkC5T85NwpA.text: I had a Dealsaver coupon that was about to expire at the end of the month and I have lived near this place for several years and it's about time I checked it out.  I sat at the bar and this was one of the best bar experiences I've ever had.  The bartender explained the draft beer selection and their specials on Carolina Craft brews.  Yay!  4 of the locals were represented including Triple C.  :)    Anyway, i had seen the pictures of the food on Yelp and pretty much decided on what I was ordering from those - Fried Pickles and Beef on Weck.  The pickles were advertised as the "Best on the Blvd" and that's probably True.  I don't know of any other places on East Blvd that even serve them.  But the slices were big and they were decent.  I like Alexander Michael's better though.   The Beef on Weck was amazing.  The weck itself was the best sandwich bread I have ever tasted.   I ordered the garlic fries with it and they were tasty with a subtle garlic flavor.     As for the venue, it's not very big and I can see this as a great neighborhood bar.  Service really shines here too.  This place is definitely worth coming back to!

-h8XaVH4cNulQiCkMUVjMg.text: Not just excellent bar food. Sure, the wings, nachos, fries, fried pickles are ALL excellent, but we go here just as much for the SUPERB fried haddock or the DELICIOUS, FRESH, & ORIGINAL SALADS!  Beyond that Lebowski's is family run & EVERY employee treats you like family.  Great weekly lunch and dinner specials, one of my favs is Wednesdays when wings are 1/2 off and bartenders pick of beer is just $3 (you give them yvour preference and they pick something in that wheelhouse ... FUN!).  You also can't beat a place that celebrates the classic The Big Lewbowski! Top it off, the white Russians and specialty white Russians are AWESOME (bunny toes and nutty Walter being my 2 favs)  Lebowski's gets my highest recommendation for the WHOLE PACKAGE ... the menu, the drinks, the atmosphere, the staff, and the attentiveness to bar fare done excellent!

mWp2__W-kTq22IiBqXOUFg.text: The place could use an update, but I guess it has character. Best margaritas ever, and you can't beat their BBQ platter, or burgers. I've honestly never had a bad experience here. Staff is super friendly and I like that they take the time to talk to you. Never feel rushed, and patio seating is perfect for summer time weather, because it's in the shade!

tXX1oSqUShSRy9Xok2peZQ.text: Don't come here expecting an over-the-top themed homage to The Great Lebowski, although there are some pictures of Jeff Bridges on the walls and references to movie characters in the menu. Came here with friends fora fun, casual evening. Definitely better than bar food, and a great bar to boot. Three of us had The Nutty Walter, smooth and just enough kick.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nutty Walter ... Stoli Razberi, Kahlua Hazelnut, Baileys Irish Cream
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Better than bar food.
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Looks like a bar but better than bar food.

hixJwjtZe1poosOv3DLFZg.text: I had read about this place having good wings and I was not let down.  I just moved down here and they have the best wings I have had yet.  Awesome staff and great atmosphere.  Will definitely be back.  Might have to go again this weekend.

mZ3B2ramAL8DWELiNSsYgg.text: Outstanding, another Charlotte hide away. I was in town for a quick visit and had been here once before. Great service great people.  Had the jive burger I think that's the name, comes with diced pineapple and tomatoes, and pepper jack cheese. Cooked perfectly. I also had a side of wings, due to the fact that Wednesday is half price wing night, so why not. Had them tossed in the honey mustard sauce. Although for me a bit too much sauce, they had a great flavor, the chicken wasn't over cooked like it can be with wings.  They have tons of beer on tap, along with a good wine selection. I would recommend this place over some of the top rated Charlotte eateries any time. Great place to dress down and enjoy the evening.

5SgBB80YnrAoio5-ibooeg.text: The more I come to Lebowski's the more I love it!  I been here at least 6 times in the past few months, both for lunch and dinner. Especially since they've been having Living Social coupons like crazy... man I love a good deal.   My boyfriend and I can't get over how a little dive bar like this has such outstanding quality food! As much as I still love the veggie burger and garlic fries here, I've totally fallen in love with their SALADS! My favorites? The Spinach (Organic baby spinach, feta cheese, red onion and dried cranberries) and The Mission Bay (Garden greens, tomato, roasted corn & black bean salsa, sliced avocado). I order both of these with a vegan patty on top and the CREAMY CILANTRO LIME dressing... best dressing ever!   My boyfriend is not a vegetarian like me, but doesn't eat as much meat as the average omnivore, he usually orders a veggie burger instead of a hamburger. But he's totally fallen in love with the quality of the Certified Angus Beef Burger here at Lebowski's.   This past Friday we came here with a Living Social coupon, so we wanted to try out an appetizer and we were particularly jonesin' for nachos, but the Niagara Street Nachos are the only ones on the menu and are centered around grilled chicken.  But no worries, I simply asked our waitress if they could make a vegetarian nacho plate... and MAN OH MAN the chef brought on an epic order I couldn't believe. Tri-color tortilla chips with queso, shredded cheddar, grilled spinach, zucchini, peppers, tomatoes, mushrooms and a side of salsa. WHAT? This blew my mind.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mission Bay salad with vegan burger, feta cheese, and creamy cilantro lime dressing
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mission Bay salad with vegan burger
