PuogcBw6HIH1MYglxnlWXQ.text: This place is chill. The service is fast and  courteous. The wings are good. The fried pickles are great. The weck is delicious.

KlBLfsrIUq3g_Z-BQEVHyw.text: Awesome food! I really wanted a fish fry like I grew up with in Buffalo and this was better. I had a junior size plate with garlic french fries. The haddock was cooked perfectly and seasoned just right. Loved the garlic fries. The wait staff was attentive and friendly. Will definitely order this again. Truly a taste of Buffalo.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soo Good!

9n4xNtqgUplvFQBsCFfqwQ.text: One of the 'Best Wings' in town and with that I choose to have their Friday special (crab cake, fried fillet, french fries and cole slaw), it was delicious. I was late for their Red velvet this time hopefully they will save some for me next. Dont think twice to try this place, just get in.  I missed the panthers flag dho

h0Y1ULLHwyq4uhmNPpalOQ.text: This was a good spot. I came in right after they had trivia night. It was late. Hopefully I can go early next time and actually have some fun with that, but let me get to the point... The food was pretty damn good. Now granted I didn't step outside the box. All I got was some wings and burger & fries. But you'll be amazed at how hard it is for some spots to get that right. I like my burgers medium well and that's the way I got it. Fries were seasoned so if you got HBP you might wanna tell them to ease back on that. But they were good too. prices were affordable. And the service was good. Overall cool spot. I'll be going again.

nIVVn53P54apINJq9h9nGg.text: If you're going for a Buffalo experience it's a 5-star. If your just out and about CLT it's a 3-star. We were a mix of people so we gave it 4-stars.

HpGaYpckiWROEizuoM1zEw.text: Best hamburgers I've had so far in Charlotte.  The fried pickles were great too.  Staff was really friendly even though they had some hostile hot customers!

HE7oRu6iNUV5qDwtmS4Irg.text: This is a great neighborhood bar. Everything I have had food wise has been excellent. I really like the Fredonia sandwich and my wife likes the Haddock fish platter and sandwich. Also love the wings and garlic fries. It is not a huge place, which I like, and just a cool place to hang out.

Qo06o67xURxvbsdaAEzYfg.text: An excellent place for what they advertise.   I have to keep typing otherwise Yelp won't accept this review, but is there really anything else to say?   I went there with my sister when she was visiting from in town. The place pleased her greatly.

EE0AlMT53ZGG5gJtSMTp8g.text: Really the only way to describe the PHENOMENAL wings, the PHENOMENAL White Russians, the PHENOMENAL fries is through song (if you're a Big Lebowski Fan you'll get the reference).......  La la la la La la la la La la la la La la la la The man in me will eat nearly any buffalo wing And as for compensation, there's little he would ask Take a white russian like you To get through to the man in me Fries are raging all around my door I think to myself I might not take it any more Take a white russian like your kind To find the man in me But, oh, what a wonderful feeling Just to know that you are near Sets my a heart a-reeling From my fingers to my mouth The man in me will eat wings so fast sometimes to keep from bein' seen But that's just because he doesn't want turn into some wing machine Took a white russian like you To get through to the man in me La la la la La la la la  (Based on the song "The Man in Me" by Bob Dylan)  Also trivia tuesdays, wing wednesdays are legit here too. Strongly suggest a visit.

Hu6GLLHEvSmg0to2oz3UIA.text: I love the fish and chips here, their fries are awesome. Great place for wings and apps. I feel a little at home because they are a Bills backers location and the upstate NY homage makes me nostalgic. I like sitting on the patio because the ambiance in the restaurant is a little dark. We've always had great service and great food.   Parking is the only real down side.

4U-2T_SaRuxz1jnXOeDh2Q.text: Get the wings.   This is literally the first thing everyone said to me when I asked about this place. So of course...I tried the wings.   Everyone was right! The wings here are damn good. I ordered 6 wings and a side of garlic fries. The wings were hot and cooked to perfection. I ordered the jerk and teriyaki sauce but all the sauces looked and smelled amazing.   Pro tip: Get some napkins because these wings are messy and finger licking good.   I can't forget to give the fries a shout out...they are delicious. I love that they are seasoned fries kicked up with the garlic flavor. Yummmm. I would order these every time!   Yes! I'll absolutely come back...for those wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic Fries
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings

xH1Qitk85QXazK3V2osbTg.text: I've heard such good things about the wings here and I finally came to try them last night.  We came for dinner around 5:30 and it was already fairly crowded, but we were seated right away.  We obviously had to get the wings and we were in luck--Wednesdays is their wing special. 6 for $6.95 or 10 for $9.95 I believe. Unfortunately, they don't let you split flavors so we got 6 with the Stinger sauce and 6 with the Jerkiyaki. We loved them. I preferred the heat of the Stinger sauce, but both were great.   We also got the Roast Beef on Weck sandwich (with horses sauce and au jus) and the Lebowski Burger. I loved the Roast Beef with both sauces. We all agreed the burger was just ok. We got garlic fries as our side (free if you check in on Yelp!) which I loved.   There were three of us and we split everything which worked out well. The service was friendly and fast.   The wings are definitely some of the best in Charlotte. I definitely recommend checking this place out if you haven't already!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lebowski Burger
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stingers wings
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerkiyaki wings

0FQkchEyGzVPAO6nZY_U7w.text: TLDR: The food is Buffalo-inspired. The service is fast. The vibe is casual. The wings are award-winning, traditional and delicious. I recommend the roast beef on 'weck with horsey and add au jus.  If you're torn between the burger and the beef on weck--theres no contest--the beef on weck is the clear winner.

p50Dqs260Gb9YI1KPBGflQ.text: I thought I reviewed them before, but I guess not. I think they have the second best wings in Charlotte! They have a dine in special on Wednesday's with .50 wings too.  We've tried all four flavors, and no one complained about one! The wings are always crisp and well sauces, and the service is always phenomenal! Try this place out! I promise you won't regret it!

Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gold rush and jeriyaki wings

K3rx7O8BUIkzptw3bnVUzQ.text: The perfect neighborhood grill. Always open. Consistent good food. Daily specials. Drink specials. Great burgers and AMAZING WINGS!!!

-WGJw4FEyz87_oYIEWltWA.text: I have heard this place has the best wings in Charlotte so of course I had to make my way to check it out.   I went here on a Saturday night around 7pm.  The parking was very tight but we were able to find some. I was told there would be a 25 min wait for 2 but it may be less which was fine. They really have no waiting area as the restaurant is pretty tight so we just stood. We actually ended up waiting for only about 15 mins.   I got 10 of the stinger wings and a order of the garlic fries. Honestly, I was more in love with the fries then the wings.. but the wings were really good too. The fries were just seasoned so good and were so crisp I wanted to eat the crumbs. In terms of the wings I think the flavor which was basically sweet + heat could have been balanced better. To me they tasted more of like hot wings didn't really get the sweet flavor. They were cooked well though.   I think the service was great and the food was good. Didn't knock my socks off though.   Would recommend for game day food and a chill relaxed atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stingers

251PDATj3mRfPRKaOjMaqg.text: This place is a neighborhood staple, which has been around for a while. Great place to order wings from on game day!   I order my to-go wings from here on game days because I think the price for the amount of wings you get is a great value. I also think they cook the wings really well -- they're always extra crispy, which is how I like them. They even give you more than 2 sticks of celery, which sadly is all that Hickory Tavern gives you.   The fried pickles are really good but very salty, so make sure you have plenty of water.   Service is good but when ordering to-go it can be quite loud inside and hard for the staff to hear you.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pickles
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stinger wings

cf9nFtgWfUxGztOF-Dz4rA.text: I had to update my review...  Consistently good food, best fish taco in town imho.  Excellent service and Kyle & Lizzie are the A-Team!    Low-key, and comfortable.  A good mix of neighbors and newbies.  A Buffalo bar, so solid personalities.  Always on my list of go-to's

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. This fish taco is still my fave!

2QwIaXtqEKjeXPjnsp89sA.text: Let me say this, If I could give Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill 10 stars, I would. I absolutely love this place. Upon walking in the door the feeling of hometown hit me. Pleasantly different from the usual franchise Grills. The staff greeted us before the entrance door could hit our heels. Although it was crowded, The hostess sat me and my partner in minutes. We had the option of sitting indoors or out. We sat indoors. I ordered the House Salad w/grilled chicken and my partner ordered the Chicken Pita. We were also able to order wine from a large selection on the wine menu. Our food came out in a timely manner and It was fresh and delicious. The portions were much larger than expected. We were completely satisfied with our meal. While there we had the pleasure of meeting the kitchen manager, Chef Kevin and also the New Owner Paul. We had a pleasant conversation about the updated menu and his plans for renovating the restaurant. Paul appeared so excited about he and his wife Merediths' plans for the future. Paul shook our hands thanking us for dining and welcomed us back.  I am definitely naming Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill a top contender in Charlotte for a fresh tasty lunch and dinner spot. With a Full bar, indoor-outdoor dining, televisions, great staff, delicious fresh food, and a relaxing atmosphere you won't be disappointed.

7hVw0vVJJF3dbdf12VYonw.text: I've come here twice now. The first time was for Wednesday wing night and the second was on a Monday afternoon for the Breckinridge Salad. Yes, I came here for a specific salad.   Wing night was enjoyable and I had the Weeping Willow Wit to accompany my wings which was delicious as well. My husband and I sat in the bar area and were not rushed. Service was decent and we said we wanted to come back. Unfortunately, life got busy and so this visit was a while ago.   When I came for lunch on Monday, I asked to be seated outside because my companion was bringing a puppy. I was told the patio was closed unless you had a dog, and I found this to be very strange. As someone who does not have a pup, I'd be upset if I wanted to sit outside, saw others outside, and was told I couldn't because I don't have a dog.   As for the food, I ordered the Breckinridge salad, buffalo style with grilled chicken and the hard boiled egg on the side. I also ordered a side of sweet potato tots thanks to so many Yelp reviewers insisting on heir deliciousness!  The salad was delicious and enough to fill me up without being stuffed. Avocado would be a welcome edition to this salad. My companion ate the hard boiled egg and seemed to enjoy it. The sweet potato tots were tasty but not cooked evenly. That was the only flaw - some pieces had harder mini "chunks" of sweet potato while others were crisp. The dip served with the tots was a cinnamon sugar dip, so delightful I could've licked the container clean. But I didn't.   I'd like to come back to Lebowski's for wing night again soon, and I think this could become a local spot for us when we just need to get out for quick, tasty food and a drink. We've talked about going here more often than we do, but maybe I will have to change that soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Weeping Willow Wit from Eastern, NC. Delicious. $4

VDvDFXq09T91TWo0ReAHVQ.text: Came in after the lunch rush, well after 3pm. No one in site to seat us. We sit. No waitress around for at least 10 minutes. Only 3 others patrons are dining. She comes out but is distracted. Comes back to us, gets our drink orders and gets lost again. Fish and Chips were good. My child orders burger sliders and menu says all sandwiches come with chips or you can get fries for 1.50 more. We assumed they were homemade chips but they were Ruffles chips from a bag. Not worth it. 2 tiny burgers for $7 with bag chips. I won't return

3jYcCycryqIPQQSmZMJeoQ.text: First time coming here and won't be our last. We each got roast beef sandwiches which were okay but their wings... their wings are delicious! Probably the best that I've had in Charlotte! It is a small spot so expect to wait a bit. We will definitely be back!'

jUTc39YAYIxUdSwfEIotxg.text: This place was great. We had a nice server who told us everything since it was our first time. I chose the Combo-Nation with the Jerkiyaki wings which were a great combination of both teriyaki and jerk but not too spicy. The garlic fries were delicious glad I chose those. I also had the turkey burger slider which also hit the spot. I see what the hype was about I shall return without a doubt.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerkiyaki wings, garlic fries, and a turkey burger slider

j-7ZylbiM-RvDyd3NG0Kiw.text: After seeing a website starting that Lebowski's had the best wings in Charlotte, I had to check it out. I went on a Wednesday and they have the wings at a discounted rate on that day. Something like $3 off the original price. Not bad if you ask me for "Best Wings" in Charlotte.   The wings came out smoking hot! They were fried perfect. The wings weren't too soggy and not too messy. Just right .   The servers were polite and made you feel welcomed. The food came out pretty quick too. The noise level wasn't too loud to have their location as a meet up for a quick lunch meeting neither.   Btw.. idk if they're the best wings in CLT but they're damn good!! Top 5 Top 5

She gave us input on all the dishes that we had question about. I will definitely be back with friends and family. Food was delicious and the service was speedy.

kUxljKozuTMgctb9CHLe9g.text: This is a Bills bar. If you are a hardcore Bills fan, this is where you should come to watch Bills games and drink a huge extensive menu of beer. It's also close to the park and after a quick jog, come over.  I know very little about football and rarely go to sports bars, so this is more for the food. It was here that I got a beer that was super good! Son of a Peach. Urgh, I wonder if it's in the west coast but I really liked this beer. Food wise, it's average. And maybe that's what sports bar food is all about. Their wings were on the drier side even though it was dripping in sauce. The breakfast burrito was a bit on the bland side. I think we came during a Bills game? There was only one television for non-Bills games and we were sharing it with other fans.

1WQt58-eogFJcL2K4gTppA.text: What a gem! I can't believe I've lived in Charlotte for 5 years and never been to Lebowski's. The ambience inside is awesome, it's cozy and inviting. The staff is extremely friendly and available when needed, even on a busy Friday night. I'm assuming it's a NY bar because of all the NY colleges and team flags that are unfair through the restaurant!   The menu is just big enough. Not so many options that it's hard to make a decision but enough to satisfy any craving. All the food we got was delicious and generous portions. We will definitely make this spot one of our regular go-tos!

LaRkkXkpaLgYAdHGTPSFQw.text: Tried this restaurant while on business.  The folks I went with spoke very highly of the restaurant and said the best time to get there is before 12.  I tried their sliders and had the Beef on Weck; meatloaf sandwich; and honey butter chicken.  They were all very good and my favorites were the roast beef and honey butter chicken.  The roast beef was very moist and the honey butter chicken is just awesome!  I would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant.

K6WHZYpL55ZCUSKS1WwSwA.text: Some of the best wings in town. It's always nice to get a bit of home (New York) down south. Great service, and a great atmosphere.

95tWQWcpGZjxCxno8_o3Vw.text: What can I say about this place? This place is outstanding the staff is great the food is awesome and the atmosphere is just like being back home in Buffalo. The best is on Sundays when the bills are playing and if you wear some bills a tire you are automatically entered into the raffle that they have but get there early because the seats go quick.

zDRhAD5aXMEr7Wbh_eAF6Q.text: I love the food here, I am a huge fan.  Their wings are usually my go to choice of food here they are among my favorite wings in Charlotte. I got some sweet potato tots with them that had a delicious dipping  sauce. I have also had some of the sliders as well as a couple roast beef sandwiches all delicious.  If in the mood to sit outside they also have a great patio on which I sat the last time I came here on Wednesday which you get 10 wings for $6 and also $3 mystery beer night. I had the gold rush and the stingers for the wing flavors and I believe I like the gold rush a tad more. But a friend told me recently to try the Blackened wings add buffalo, so pumped for that on my next visit.  Their white russians here are also very tasty and better yet this place is named after and themed to one fantastic movie: The Big Lebowski.   "Yeah, well, you know, that's just, like, your opinion, man." -- The Dude

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. 6 stingers and 6 gold rush with sweet potato tots and of course ranch. With a Sapporo on mystery beer and 60 cent wing night.

HOOxwqoEQMmBWV4uI1yeOA.text: I'm a fan of the movie, the Lebowski Burger and Gold rush wings. Great place to grab lunch or dinner or late night snack. It is a sports bar and it can get boisterous but I like that atmosphere every now and then. The lighting in the evening is dim, which can make a night out with the hubs seem romantic until I get Gold sauce all over my fingers, but not so dark that you struggle to read the menu. Seating is sometimes limited for large parties, but we never had a problem with 2 or 3.    We come here once or twice a month and  I oscillate between the Lebowski Burger (Angus burger topped with roast beef and queso on a weck roll) and the Gold wings. Definetly a Yankee thing to have to pay extra to swap chips for fries or any other side but not a deal breaker. The garlic fries are good but I usually try to order a salad when I get the Lebowski Burger.   'Dat burger. Mmmm. 'Dat burger. So thick and juicy! I think the caraway seeds and salt on the Weck roll is what sets it above all other burgers. Or it could be the queso sauce. I keep saying I will try the beef on weck or some other entree but I haven't had the willpower yet. It calls to my soul and I give in almost every time.   Wings. Yup. They know what they're doing. Gold Wings are a sweet, spicy tangy sauce and the wings are perfectly crisp. I could eat 20 by myself. Okay, maybe 30 if I was starving and had no haters dining with me, but I usually split 10 with the hubs for an app.   They have daily specials (I always want to come here for the Monday Date Night special - 2 burgers for $12 - but we never seem to make it over there).  We've been for the Wednesday Wing special before (1/2 price wings) but I probably will never do that again. I have a lack of self control around chicken wings.

l7HLQVREyurDA_kC673xrA.text: I came here for the sweet potato tots. Good wings and Meatloaf too! Nice place to hang out and good size parking lot for this location!

lBKs1UnieE9XoNSIv_MYGA.text: This place is a total neighborhood joint. A diehard buffalo bills bar, this place serves some of the best wings I've ever had in my life. The Gold rush and garlic parm wings are good but the Jerkiyaki are AMAZING.

7aLKhaBoanRPlkD9pRhjNw.text: My all time favorite cheat meal ~ a good old fashioned #cheeseburger & fries!  This is my first time Lebowski's Grill & their burger did not disappoint! And thx to Yelp, I got free garlic fries, just for checking in!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. When you go, ask for Brandy. If she&#39;s working the bar, sit there. She&#39;s the best server I&#39;ve had in a long time. Trust me on this one!
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. All the tacos! I tried all 3 - pork, chicken &amp; haddock. Delish.
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

uL0kBueaJzPbYl5HLNKunw.text: OMG the roast beef sandwich is amazing and the wings I think are the best in CLT. Be mindful this is a whole in the wall place, but really good food. Open late

QlDClVwtuCZKIpg3f5KELA.text: Charlotte has a derth of independent restaurants with decent food for a good price; Lebowski's is an exception.  Their daily specials are a deal.  The portions are plentiful, the beef on wek is delicious, and I haven't found a better fried fish plate in town.  Try the garlic fries...thin and crunchy.  As far as ambiance goes it is definitely sports oriented with lots of TVs; and if you don't want to get caught in the loudness of Trivia night avoid Tuesdays!

URY2SyPrqVJOk1bSVkthJw.text: Wednesday wing specials. Big ol wangs! I ordered the 10 count and put away only 6. My eyes are bigger than belly. Local brews too.

jti456Csz-4aUEVrJspcKg.text: We had originally planned to go the the Cheesecake Factory, we waited about two hours and still didn't get a table then; we went to bad daddy's burger bar. It was crazy they told us It would be about an hour so we decided to try this place. This was by far one of my favorite restaurants of all time! I can say the blew bad daddy's out of the water!!!! I've been a vegetarian for almost 16 years and really the only thing I can find out to eat is veggie burgers. You could substitute about any chicken or meat on the menu for hot Buffalo Cauliflower Bites. I had a buffalo cauliflower wrap and It was my favorite food of all time! My husband loved the wrap and he's a meat eater. Our waitress was so nice and It was a very relaxing spot. We ate outside and It was quiet and we could actually talk and enjoy ourselves! I can't wait to go back. We live about an hour away but It worth the drive and the prices are great too. I am so glad we found this place.

J-nF-0ampT4S3bZEbChnVA.text: It was a beautiful day in Charlotte and I decided to take a walk up to East Blvd. and grab a bite to eat...so it was between Lebowski and its neighbor, they won... I ordered the Memphis with garlic fries. The sandwich was okay, perfectly grilled bread but the pulled pork was not as tender as I'd like, but the BBQ sauce was delicious, sweet with just enough tang to it, that and the garlic French fries were what earned them a 4 star! The fries were served fresh and hot and with a just right crunch and the perfect amount of seasoning.

8u60p5C1DpfMAK3uONrW6w.text: Great neighborhood bar, the beef on weck is solid and the wings are as good as any I have ever had. Very happy with the customer service and will definitely be back next time I am in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

Y2VvCj3jpFWgMog_mJqcBQ.text: I'm back again, I know I have reviewed this place before and given a five star review but it just keeps getting better and better every time that I come. I just ordered the three sliders and got one buffalo, one beef on weck and one meatloaf slider. They were all three so delicious! My favorite was the beef on the weck but the other two were close contenders. The service is always above and beyond. Everyone is so nice. I absolutely love the decor and the vibe of this place. The music is great and the drinks are better. Wide variety of local beers! Can't wait to come back so soon!

9cwHJSHwfLwQaluuvpKwGw.text: My go-to late night spot! They have great drink specials (try the White Russians!!) consistently good food, and the atmosphere is relaxed and friendly. The late night menu has options for meat eaters and vegetarians, so I find something for every mood. Plus, it's a local business and the waitstaff are efficient and always ready with a recommendation! Highly recommend.

4Jd3TOUCxxiHIHKq9h5t7Q.text: We've gone here twice, but each time it's so hot in there it's just too miserable to stay. How about getting that air conditioning fixed???

VVJHhZFsjQi2WY0v31GDSg.text: After a few more trips to Lebowski's, I've gotta up my stars to five. The atmosphere is cozy and fun, the food is way better than typical bar food, and the service is pretty much on-point. Throw in some crazy cheap prices, and Lebowksi's is knocking it out of the park.

cTtWKwy4r-bfo_zJklrq7A.text: This place has arguably the best casual/bar food in the city. The wings are absolutely fantastic (medium buffalo ordered extra-crispy are our favorite), and the other items are always consistent. The beef on weck (with "horsey" sauce) and haddock fish fry will not disappoint. Try the signature Lebowski Caucasian White Russian from the bar as a nice change-up from your typical bar drinks.

3jSttt1LnAtHpH1Tk_Mh9g.text: We love, love, love this place!  It is a hometown, laid-back kind of bar that just happens to have awesome food, but not pub food.  The menu is small enough to have options but not so large that they cannot maintain quality.  I had the beef on weck and my husband had the sliders. Both options were great, but I won hands down with the beef on weck.  The roast beef did not have any chewy (gross) bites and the bread was ahhh-mazing!  The garlic fries were perfect as well.  Now to the best part...the service.  Jen was our assigned server, but everyone seemed to check in and take responsibility for the customers.  Jen was truly outstanding!  She was so personable and gave us great recommendations for other restaurants to try in the neighborhood.  When the food is good, the atmosphere is good, and the server is GREAT.....we will be back time and time again.  I would give this place more stars if I could and I will have to pace myself so that I do not burn out on it!

4lYx8AV_HyNbXYTh8B6vtA.text: Lebowskis over the past couple years has turned into our local watering hole. The staff is awesome and really pleasant to talk to. All of the staff really knows there food and drink menu's. They always have awesome food and beer specials no matter what night you go there and the menu is always changing and getting better. I recommend trying the trio dip. There homemade pimento cheese dip is on point. They also have a nice little patio outside. If the weather ever gets below 90 in the summer it is the perfect place to have a few drinks with friends. They also have trivia on Tuesdays that is a lot of fun to go with some friends.

0gXGPgSr22ytaUhutOngZA.text: I went here on Monday, Jan. 6, 2014 with my Groupon deal.  It was kind of slow and not as spacious.  I tried Sicilian wings, a salad and a sandwich.  The Sicilian chicken wings were different but the taste was not as I pictured.  I will give them 5 points for the salad and presentation.  The sandwich will be an acquired taste.  Overall, I would go back again to watch the game.

_W7wCdctri_H7wxcniqrIA.text: Awesome!  This is a great neighborhood restaurant/bar with patio seating and good service.  I typically order something new at places so I can try everything, but it is incredibly difficult to not order the wings, or at least the beef on weck.  I love the hot or jerkiyaki wings.  I try not to say that somewhere has the best anything, unless it is True... Lebowski's has the best wings you will get anywhere.  The owner, Kirk, is from Buffalo and he knows his stuff.  They cook the wings the right way, using fresh chicken wings and he puts them on the flat top to help crisp them up.  You won't be able to eat BW3 or any other crap wings ever again without comparing them to Lebowski's.

orjWq4m2F4e-XI6gGEsiVg.text: LOVE this restaurant! It's one of my regular spots now. All the servers I've had so far have all been GREAT!! They have some kind of fish dinner that is to-die-for. Big portions for the price you pay. I usually can't finish all of my fish, but I can't avoid stuffing myself from trying! I also usually get the "Bunny Toes" drink. It's like a mint-chocolate White Russian (has Bailey's mint chocolate in it). It's delicious!!

hs1h0LLZckp4d4ghHn2__A.text: Went during prime dinner time hour on a Saturday evening and was pleasantly surprised at the lack of wait. We were seated immediately in the patio area, which was lovely because the weather was very agreeable, i.e. not ridic humid and hot. Our drink orders were taken immediately, but the waitress took forever getting back to us for our meal orders. Had to wait another eternity (or what felt like eternity because I was starving) for the food to come. Had the garden burger veracruz style with a side of mac n cheese. Burger was not bad but not super memorable because I was already on the verge of forgetting I had eaten it the moment I finished devouring it. Mac n cheese was nothing special either, but plus points for using curly macaroni that held in more cheese than elbow mac. My friend got their "Legendary Wings" and thought they were delicious, but not legendary. Not a place I'd have cravings for, but still a solid neighborhood bar.

ReYPGyJmRddKFFfoJT1TOA.text: This place rocks.  Have been there a few times, and every time the food has been great!   Highlights: Beef on Weck, Mac 'n Cheese, Burgers, Jerkyaki Wings, Sliders.    Fun little bar as well, and cool theme drink menu -- check it out!

285l0TqqHuqfEk0_UnAdHA.text: We discovered Lebowski's Grill about 2 months ago and started becoming a regular to hear Jeff Brown, a talented local musician who plays here on Thursdays with an eclectic music selection, as well as his own stuff.  This definitely fits the bill for a neighborhood bar.  It's quite a cozy and friendly place.  The food here is excellent and they have quite a bit to offer for vegetarians.  I love the pimento & cheese burger which, like all of their burgers, can be made vegetarian.  The outdoor seating area is shaded and covered and a great spot to be on cooler evenings.  They have quite a few micro brews on tap, including the Charlotte-brewed OMB (Olde Mecklenburg Brewery), Two-Hearted Ale, and Fat Tire among others.  The owner is a music fan and you can see some of his extensive album collections on the walls.  The only addition is that they need a bike rack in the front.

7S4mleiYBhSnAr1fLJnorQ.text: Was in Charlotte on business. Came to Lebowskis due to the great Yelp reviews. Was not disappointed. The Fredonia dip was great (must get it 'Wack-ed!). Lizzie was  excellent behind the bar and her Cinnamon Toast Crunch (TM) shot brought me back to my childhood!

qUfFioQfZ5XkESI0kQR-qQ.text: Not my favorite.  I've been in twice now and each time I was really uninspired with the food I ordered.  It's pretty standard bar food but there was no wow factor.  The second time I went in was a total bummer.  I was strugglin' that day and just needed something delicious.  I ordered the nachos which arrived cold, as in the artificial cheese (like snack booth style) was COLD.  The server didn't really seem to care which didn't really help make matters any better.  Weak Sauce.

TtJcHB9aSdkgvkS-y3nCQQ.text: Great food and some really good beer specials are the highlight for me. Mystery beer night is my favorite!

_18fMthIzwRY6XdLcGx6Fg.text: Always good food and service.  Excellent fish and chips.

Uns5vL07zT_mpbOK75XIHA.text: Great neighborhood pub.  Food is better than expected from a cozy family sports pub.  Daily food and happy hour specials make it very affordable.  Reliable staff service and food.  The beef on a wreck (salted bun) is a real stand out.  Wings are great.

It2PKAYefidzAibaMpo6wQ.text: Beef on Weck was OUTSTANDING! They must have the buns made especially for them as I've never seen one like it. The top has coarse salt and caraway seeds. The roast beef is shaved and has a savory tan color. Its tender and properly proportioned to the bun. A tray of spicy mustard, horsradish and horsey sauce comes to the table so each bite gets its own special dressing. French fries were crispy, hot and slightly battered. Loved it all and the place filled up quite well at lunch.

pPoYIiYy2dfQoj2YNMSuBA.text: Had the Fried Pickles and Amy's Wrap, very good. The server was very nice and it was a fun place. The patio was perfect for a great November afternoon.

LGVPxSQ-K_7-6vmRDriXQw.text: Having read reviews, we decide to try this place.  The chicken wings,  beef on weck, macaroni cheese were all good.  Husband had even the genesee beer.  Have lived in Buffalo, they even had Salemn hotdog during the weekend.    Staff was friendly, yes we will be going back again ! Parking would be a pain.

MxeoZi6ok8B6roKKX751RA.text: We decided to try this restaurant only because it was very nearby to an event we were to attend this night.  Wow were we ever pleased!  Great food, service and environment.  Friendly people; we later learned that our server was actually one of the co-owners!  Try the sliders assortment, ya can't go wrong!  Since our initial visit we've actually been back twice and continue to enjoy this fine little gem on East Blvd in Charlotte!

aZfudqXm4nE0wZU-BFvHyw.text: Don't let the 3 stars fool you. This place is actually pretty good just not 4 star worthy just yet.The place is very small and if you like a more intimate bar this is the place for you. They play some alternative music, which I have never heard in a bar before. The service is slow, even with there not being many people at the bar/ restaurant. I honestly expected there to be a whole lot more people there on a Football Sunday. The cool thing about this place is that they support local breweries and that is always a plus for me. That in itself almost brought them up to 4 stars. The food portion in my book was kinda small. I had what everyone recommends the "Beef Weck" it was really good and the Au Jus sauce was excellent but again too small and to pay an additional .45 cents for a dipping sauce to me is just crazy. Also, I guess that this place in a Buffalo Bills hangout spot with all of the memorabilia and the Flutie Flakes? I will be going back again when I am in the mood for a nice low key night with not too much going on. The food was ok and the drinks were fine. I believe that this is a everyday kinda bar for the normal type of person. Just like the name entails "relax... man"

HbuXlATGX6AVC1zI2oZ5JQ.text: Amazing Bar & Grill with incredible food for a bar atmosphere. This is one of my favorite places to go in Charlotte on any night of the week there are specials to be had. Trivia on Tuesday is always fun and is an ideal spot for both a low key dinner but also an excellent nightlife location! I highly recommend Lebowski's!

G1CJTpHDuNXXwjhc1U6w4A.text: Pretty good food with great drink specials.  It's a cozy restaurant/bar that's open until 2 am. Definitely a place to check out, especially when all the other neighborhood restaurants have a table wait list.

RCrW_aLcjvR2-iLfo0bW1Q.text: Good beer selection and bar food.  It has a cozy, local pub feel to it.  Started with fried pickles.  Never tried in my life until starting to travel to Charlotte.  Now, can't stay away from them.  Especially on a Monday night with football on the TV.  Chicken Florentine Panini was also a call that I don't regret.  Magic Hat #9 from beer list was light & had an unexpected smoothness to it that was very nice.  More refreshing than your typical pale ale.

CHgP6Lj0soOYGBNKv5zCXg.text: Pretty cool little neighborhood bar, good food, great and varied beer selection, and cool friendly peeps working the place.    We're not really regulars here, but friends of ours basically live in here, so we do come in a good bit.  The patio has some TVs so you can enjoy the weather if it's nice outside without missing the game.  They also have karaoke several nights a week too, so if that's your kind of thing, then try to time your visit accordingly.  Oh yeah, the food! I really only get the wings, but I can say that they should be the only thing on the menu.  They're awesome flavors and perfectly cooked, get them and forget the rest!

OwI2OWd3sSD_I3KgkGpWSQ.text: Wow. Where to begin. I guess I should probably state for the record that I'm an avid Big Lebowski fan. Been out to the Lebowski-fest, had myself a bowling league based around it, and simply can't get enough of watching it.  The movie really is a cult classic. I feel that it is a fantastic restaurant "theme" that this business pulls off very well. If you are a fan, you need to come and check out this place. Its not just the name of the restaurant that attracts, but the decor as well. Very nicely decorated interior with all sorts of related memorabilia.   The food options are broad, pretty generic, but overall VERY good (for what I've tried, to date). You won't find any fancy movie quotes/ names on the menu other than the Lebowski's Burger, which by the way, is also pretty damn good. Beer selection is also broad. The outdoor seating is great in the summer.  Overall, an absolute great restaurant/ bar, and would definitely be the dude's local hangout joint.

ROHb-qhwdt1HQs7FeMrgIA.text: The sweet potato tots are a must have when choosing a side, thanks in part to the delicious creamy cinnamon dip that accompany them. Pulled pork BBQ sandwich and stingers wings were also delicious! Great, relaxed atmosphere and extensive drink menu.

W7-5yTZdS6Odd-dMMMq5dA.text: First time visit was yesterday for lunch. It was relaxing and tasty. I had the fried haddock and garlic fries (junior portion - generous serving) and it was incredibly tasty. Some if the best best fried fish I've eaten!  The garlic fries were divine. Substituted cinnamon apples for the slaw. Also tasty. My mother had the Angus beef burger and declared it delicious and perfectly cooked. Wait staff attentive and knowledgeable. Will return!

C82O-t5lNq1UQXjcooQxbg.text: It definitely exceeded my expectations! From the outside it looks like a basic bar, not appealing to me, but once we entered it was very open with plenty of seating and didn't have a "bar" feel.   There are tvs on each wall so we were able to watch the March Madness basketball games very comfortably. We even chuckled to see an old arcade game. It looks like they may have Wii games too...since there was a Wii system hooked up to one of the tvs.   They have limited vegetarian options; however, the veggies nachos and the veggie burger were pretty good. The french fries had an extra layer of batter and nice and crisp.   Good experience overall!

Zy52cKEDHOptMYuLsS8eFg.text: Perfect little neighborhood place to grab a beer and some wings. The food is great and the staff is super friendly. I will totally be back.

uT-zKgg_iwImbsAwdF0grw.text: Food is great, reasonable priced about $9-12 for many of the dishes. Everything is made their in the restaurant and you can taste the difference. Had their wings and fries. tastes so good. My only discontentment was the waitress. She wasn't very friendly or prompt. Don't sit on the side closest to the entrance door. I think she serves that area often. Everything else was great.

EFTppzlh9Kt4pyBRbpVAOg.text: Awesome burger; perfect tacos and also the grilled sandwiches are pretty good! In addition to that they have the best fries!!! Prices are very reasonable!!

f2PFK8T6yEGS7RIQe_5rwQ.text: Very good food.  Recommend the wings and the haddock fish fry.  A fun setting with references to The Big Lebowski movie, and good service.

NhBmgNgNARRwo8kAdMusxQ.text: We walk here all the time and our kids love the food and atmosphere.  All of the staff are very friendly.  They have a good selection on the menu and great beer choices.  They have consistently good service and food.  Also what's great is that it is very casual and we can come in sports attire or choose to dress up as well.  We appreciate having a great place to eat in the neighborhood that won't break the bank!

W484e04rZBeGk-Go0vIsIA.text: Came in from out of town and found this place. Great food and service. We got the wings and the burger both were fabulous.

1GoGZuP2uzqtFrrza-eNJA.text: This place was delicious! Started off with the wings, which were cooked perfectly and coated in gold rush and jerkiyaki sauces. My husband ordered the lebowski burger paired with garlic French fries. I had the fredonia sandwich with the pasta salad. In addition to great food, we got great service as well. Our drinks were never less than half full! If you are in the area definitely worth a lunch or dinner here!

dgFqdubqGiZ8cCk4iT-k0g.text: Went to lunch on New Year's Eve which likely was our hundredth time here.  Good as usual - beer is always good and we enjoy the turkey burger or Greek pita.  While the owners haven't said boo to us over the last couple of years, ever, Lizzy is our usual server and  we appreciate her remembering us and her wanting to be our server.  We come in to see her.  Unfortunately, she wasn't here this day.  Menu options are getting old and with new competition, we may not be as frequent dinners as we have in the past.

ckpWavBXbzy4h_rENAhIRg.text: My boyfriend and I both had two items on the menu that claimed to be awarded "best of Charlotte" and although they were not bad, I wouldn't quite say that they're the best in the city. He had the beef on weck and I had the jerk style burger. They were just average.   Other than the food, I like the concept. We went on trivia night and although we left before it started, it got packed. It seemed like a fun neighborhood hangout.

claH02Q57mOolTmfAaIdsQ.text: A very solid 3.5 ...  Atmosphere- My mom would hate it because it is a bit older and has a mildew(y)  scent. I on the other hand see it as eclectic...they had some Bob Marley playing and of course The Dude plastered just about everywhere. The Sabres banner didn't hurt either (I'm a UB grad ).  The bathroom was clean and overall the restaurant was tidy.   Food- I loved the B-lo touches. Franks, Sahlen's, Weber's...they've got it covered. I went with the Fredonia; a beef on weck of sorts served with horsey, melted provolone, au jus, pressed like a panini in a hoagie (sprinkled with caraway and coarse salt). I loved the au jus but I like my horsey straight on horseradish(y) aka much spicier. I will say their garlic fries were some of the best I've ever tasted. I splashed those suckers with malt vinegar and I was in heaven. My other half got a fish fry, he didn't seem too thrilled about it and he is pretty easy to please. He mistook the  beer bottle for the malt vinegar and still ate the fries though,that's how good they were!   Drinks- They had a special running that day, Monday $3 bartender bottles choice (meaning the bartender chooses a new beer each time). They weren't Miller Lite's and we were able to give a little direction on our choice (We were given Pilsner Urquell and a Ranger IPA). No complaints in that department : )   Service- We had a younger gentleman serve us, and he did a great job. He was very upbeat and friendly. The food came out super-fast (like how'd they do that ? fast)   Just a tip, they have another Monday deal two burgers for $10, I'm sure we'll return to get some of those with plenty of the delicious garlic fries.

52E_eRStHfa1QoD3yz7mgw.text: Fabulous food, especially the Haddock!  A friend took me there and I've taken many others there!  Great service, wonderful atmosphere, everything anyone has ordered has been excellent!

vAmOGN76lb9Pbz1nwjpPuA.text: I have to say I love gong to Lebowski's.  In fact I think I would love going to any place that was written up as having one of the best sandwiches in Charlotte, but this one really comes through.  A nice place, very inviting, small bar where I think everyone really could know your name.  but on to more urgent matters.  There are three words I am thrilled to hear upon walking into this place, besides "pick a table" and that is "BEEF ON WECK."  It in itself is worth the trip.  Roast beef sliced thin and piled high on a weck roll, fresh made roll with course salt and rye seeds, it is out of this world.  Before going to Buffalo way too often in the past I had never heard of Beef on Weck and once my wife and I decided to move to Charlotte I thought I would never hear of it again.  But I have to say Lebowski's offered it, I loved it and the rest is history.  I'll be back many times I'm sure and I would say everyone needs to try it at least once.

i5_ndiLUKwVDuUk75-MPsA.text: Went here for lunch a few weeks ago with a friend.  Have always heard great things and I was not in any way disappointed.  I had wings to open - two different kinds including traditional buffalo wings plus a pepper style wing that was a little sweeter.  Both were excellent - well cooked and just the right seasoning.  I particularly loved the buffalo wings.  I moved on to a beef on 'weck au jus with horse radish sauce and it was flipping fantastic.  Service was good, atmosphere was fun - loved everything about it.  Great job, great place!

ALEHOx48oZvvcerPma_eng.text: This neighborhood was in desperate need of a burger joint with reasonable prices and friendly atmosphere.  Lebowski's fits the bill.  I haven't found a $6 burger this good anywhere else.  Although getting fries will bump your tab up $2, it's not pretentious but not too low-brow either, like some other places across the street.    They have drink specials to boot.  On Wednesday's it's the only $4 Jack & Coke in the neighborhood.  The dirty rice was cooked perfectly and well-seasoned.  Burgers are juicy and even their pulled pork gives serious barbecue joints around town a run for their money.  Avoid the apple pie dessert, it's definitely pre-packaged/frozen, but maybe some of the other desserts are better.  Shocking really, how many trixies were in here on a Saturday night but I think that will cure itself eventually.  It doesn't present itself as that kind of a bar and should attract the right kind of people in no time.  I think I just found my new favorite place to eat in Dilworth.

Xp6-6YYKQw48Dz7dNL6A4g.text: Stopped in on a Sunday night and was glad to see an almost packed restaurant. There were several TV's playing football games. We were seated and helped right away.  I ordered the Jerk burger, while my husband ordered a burger that had roast beef on top. The jerk burger had a really great taste and I enjoyed the toppings on it. I paid extra for fries instead of chips and noticed right away they were cooked to order. Some places serve fries that even though come out hot you can tell they have been sitting under a warmer. This was not the case at Lebowskis. My husband enjoyed his burger. First time having roast beef on top. He did say he wished there was more roast beef but the burger itself was pretty large. We also had a grilled cheese kids meal and a slider meal on our menu. I really loved how there was an option to mix and match sliders giving the option to try more than one kind. My children seldom finish their food and we always have left overs, this didn't happen dining at Lebowskis. Restaurant was kid friendly especially with the football game going on. The inside is slightly small so the tables are close together but my kids were really well behaved ( thank goodness) so this wasn't necessarily a problem.  Service was great, food was made  quickly and our drinks always remained full. Price was average for a family of four especially since the food was great. Will definitely return when in the area!

i9doCFkYopryVLg1kkqosg.text: Great service. Took my husband and little girl here and everyone enjoyed their food. Cant wait to go back and try more things. We got the wings!

_DcTJTCO5ec3esMzKk8ZyQ.text: Decent food. I went here with a few friends the other night and ordered their world famous wings and fried fish. It was good but not world famous...

HGN_5my3Vkyp33bmHYLgpA.text: Lots of beer selections and great bar food. Wings are crispy, good char, and tasty sauces. Also comes with good portion of celery, which is rare. And beef on a weck is stacked and my #1 get on the menu (with au jus)!

Nwo3_t5Y-L_1Z7nEg3M7rg.text: Ate here again last night - best wings in charlotte for sure.  Also had the garlic fries which were super!  It was crowded, but we were able to eat at the bar without a wait - bartender was super friendly.

itmlw1Lh3ylCuawVQEgFdw.text: 3.5 stars   We stopped by Lebowski's for the first time yesterday for HH. I love the fact that Lebowski's have daily lunch and dinner specials on top of daily drink specials and HH two times a day from 4-6p and 10p-12a. There is also a fabulous Groupon deal right now, get on it! I don't like the fact that the parking lot is kind of a mess, very inconvenient that there isn't a second or larger exit. (Docked half a star.) We parked in the back but luckily were able to back out before running into trouble. There was Bills stuff everywhere! I'd love to watch a game here sometime, I'm sure they would have great specials.   Luckily, we were able to find a couple of bar seats right away as it wasn't as packed as I thought it would be at 5:45p. We ordered a couple of the $4 house White Russians which were $1 off...it was really strong at first but it tasted great..very comparable to melted Thrifty's ice cream..yum, my childhood. But beware, there is a TON of half and half in them, not diet friendly at all. We also ordered the spinach artichoke dip and tacos (1 chicken and 1 haddock). I enjoyed the spinach artichoke dip, tasted better than the dip offered at Crave. It also came with fresh tortilla chips and mini garlic toasts. I didn't like the tacos as much, there was way too much cabbage slaw that had a overpowering horseradishy/vinegary after taste. (Docked a star)The salsa was also on the sweet side but I didn't mind, I thought it went well with the fish. The chicken was well seasoned and juicy, I'd order this again and tell the server to have the kitchen go easy on the slaw.   Don't worry, I'm sure this rating will go up after I get my hands on the wings or battered fish plate. We will be back for more.

ZklzauQZFFkIcTW0v-JZWw.text: Once again Yelp comes through!!!  Lebowski's is GREAT. Small and cozy with good games on the TV. The wigs are where it's at. I had the Jerkiyaki and there were perfect. The Blue Cheese is on point and the Yuengling was nice and cold. I would have given 5 stars but the Yuengling wasn't on top!!! 10 wings and a beer for $16.00.

c0qU306Ia4fS9mbmOj0GFw.text: Ever go to a restaurant and get met by someone with a sour face and a surly attitude? That won't happen at Lebowski's. If there's one thing I notice every time, and as my husband will tell you, COMMENT on every time, it's how friendly everyone at Lebowski's is.   We first tried Lebowski's after my husband heard about the authenticity of their Buffalo wings. The owner is from Buffalo, I believe, and it IS the Buffalo Bills bar in Charlotte. I went a few hours out of a trip up north just to have wings at the Anchor Bar in Buffalo, so my husband knew I'd be on board with trying a joint known for its authentic wings.  We visit Lebowski's most often on Sunday around midday. Football games are on the television, and the routine is pretty much the same for me. My husband mixes up his orders, and his beers, depending on what they have on tap. I'm a horrible beer drinker (Bud Light, I consider it my karmic punishment for drinking so much beer) and a sucker for fish and chips, so that's what I get every time. Oh, in addition to an order of Buffalo wings.  The first time the server asked me if I wanted the "junior" size fish and chips, I asked her what she thought, since I'd never seen the serving size before. Fortunately she told me it would be fine. I have to wonder what the "full" size fish and chips is like, because the "junior" size takes up a massive plate!  The food is delicious. The environment is a million kinds of awesome, with the "Dude" theme going in full force. And as I said, the people who seat you, take your orders and bring your food are so nice I might invite them to Thanksgiving dinner next year.  "Neighborhood grill" describes Lebowski's perfectly. We live several neighborhoods south of Lebowski's, but are willing to make the drive every time we come here. Some Sundays I just wake up and mutter, "Lebowski's?" to my husband when I first see him. It's just that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Dude abides at Lebowski&#39;s.

HrpvxQpCVg1ZgrD7lWH1-A.text: Quick recap: awesome environment, good food, amazing White Russians of course, great service. This is a spot everyone should come here at least once. And when you do, get the garlic fries. Amazing.   Place was a little dark but it kind of fits the mood. Posters and pictures of The Dude are everywhere so if for some strange reason you're not a fan of his, you might want to avoid this place.   I got a burger with garlic fries. While the burger was good, the garlic fries hit the spot like none other. It's an extra dollar if I remember right but it's worth so much more.   Of course I had a White Russian with my meal and it was on point. Not much to complain about at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger with garlic fries.

cQMKEVne3eqqOFFI_20MYw.text: We wanted to like this place. Liked the ambience, the outside sitting area and thought that it was quaint. Our server was horrible and that probably did not help. She would disappear for long stretches of time. The wings that we had as an appetizer were really good and they might be worth giving the restaurant a second chance!  We both had sandwiches and they were not good at all. Thought that the menu was typical, and honestly if the menu is so small then the items on it should be outstanding. Other than the wings that we had, that was not the case.  If you're in the mood for wings I think give it a shot! If you're in the mood for anything else... Look else where.

2sV5duEq5Ng6Dualy4xVnQ.text: Went last night and had the famous roast beef! The roast beef was as well done and dry as you can get. When I ordered it I asked for it rare as they can make. The waitress informed me after the fact that it's cooked during the day and thats the way it's done. They have a large picture on the wall of a rare delicious looking sandwich. I asked her why the False advertising.....if you like well done dry beef go there. The service is awful also.

Q10QO7YSwFiSfc8XpqUvHQ.text: Love this place so much great deals on wing Wednesday really good food for a bar style place I come here at least once a month

y1frwkuPr62djarVB7qLDw.text: Omg.. Did someone say French fries! Yum!!  Ordered some to go.. Thrilled.. hot and crunchy!!! The Ranch is fantastic also!!!   As for the.. sweet potato tots. I'd tread carefully here. If you like a slight crispy outside with sweet potato mush, this is for you. It comes with a sweet dip. I had zero affinity for it or the tots  If anything, stick with the fries!!

wzCJqgr0zJpnnaa6OsX0_A.text: I went here quite a few times. Love their sliders and their wings. Especially Wednesday Wings night. I'm also addicted to their meatloaf. 3 patties with gravy potatoes and veggies. I'm very picky about other people's meatloaf because I make some awesome meatloaf. I mean that's all I know how to cook beside steaks. I enjoyed most of their sliders. Their cheeseburger, haddock and coleslaw and of course the meatloaf and gravy sliders are some of my favorites!! As for the wings. I like the Gold Rush and the Jerkiyaki are my go to.  Customer service is alway great. Can be a little off when it's crazy pack. The parking sucks at times. You can't make reservations. But other than that, I will continue to come back for those sliders and wings!

jsLbW9s06ilTPyjNw2v-3A.text: Lebowski's has earned another star :-)  When you walk in, the decor is so basic and homey. There are certainly no frills at this place, but the food is great. Staff is cool and the whole vibe is just so laid back. It is all table seating (+ of course the small bar) & the dining area is very open.  ...This time I had a Greek salad w/ grilled chicken. It was humongous and sooo good. Sometimes when a place throws some chicken on a salad, the chicken is so bland, as if just for the sake of having it on there. Here though, the chicken actually had flavor.  I also had some of the Trio Dip Platter and it was equally de-lish. (And) very well could have served as the entree.  This is the type of place where you wanna get what you had the last time because it was so good, but then again wanna try something else because it all looks so appetizing.  Here, I would say it is pretty safe to experiment a bit. They seem to know what they are doing and aren't stingy about it either!

rSRRjO0_b5F-QC7aLq42fA.text: The E-Street pita is very tasty. The spot tots and the cinnamon butter is awesome. They are just very stingy with how many they give you compared to other restaurants . It was freezing and would not seat us outside . The fans were blowing my hair while I ate. Staff is friendly .

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

QRx9A9JOeWqwDC96vaot2A.text: If you're looking for an upscale dining experience, look elsewhere.  If you're looking for a comfortable neighborhood bar that focuses on the food and a unique atmosphere go here.  I've been searching for great wings in Charlotte for years and I've found them.  They do them the buffalo way and they are delicious.  The beers were cold and the staff was friendly.  The owner and his daughter were behind the bar and were very friendly and conversational, if you like that kind of thing.  I got french fries with my wings and they were on point.  The blue cheese was over seasoned and not enough crumbles for my liking, but still enjoyable.  I would give this place 5 stars, but the only thing they're lacking is their TV situation for sports.  I scratched my head when I heard that it's the biggest Bills bar in the Carolinas when I saw they only have two small out dated TV's behind the bar.  Nevertheless, next time I have friends in town and we're in the mood for wings, I'm taking them to Lebowski's  The owner told me the meatloaf is worth coming back as well so I'll try that next time.

cSzd0ghKLbK9LACHhNPi4Q.text: Should probably get your parking situation in order. There are 4 marked spaces behind the building. All others unmarked. Waitress kept coming out yelling at everyone trying to park in the unmarked spaces. Annoyed already and will never come to Lebowskis now.

VSJRgFe9ZGgbGdtAz9kO8Q.text: Service was quick! Food was just ok.  I had tacos which can with a great amount of meat. The flavor was bland.

UVQwePQd7sQ2Cj2JdBvkIg.text: The food here is good. The service is quick.  The prices are reasonable. I like the environment because it is just comfortable and casual. I will definitely be back for a second try!

12KFA64MvFWqo9rOGFUdPQ.text: Great Food! Period! The White Fish amazing and always fresh! Friends who have eaten here all have had a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Haddock &amp; Fries with a side of Cole Slaw aka Fish &amp; Chips is always fresh and delicious!

3lQCV20jEnlk7aNHVj2y0A.text: All I can say is "LET'S GO BUFF-A-LO!!!!" with my entire family from & living in western NY. I must say I was a skeptic when I read an online article claiming I could find authentic buffalo wings and other western NY delicacies, such as haddock and beef on weck in Charlotte. BOY WAS I WRONG! Hands down, easily the BEST wings in Charlotte, no brainer. (So good I had 20 wings for lunch and I'm going back to pick up 30 wings for dinner) But to my surprise, the beef on weck was some of the best beef on weck I've had in my entire life, while being hundreds of miles away from New York. And a special treat, for real authentic western New Yorkers, they have Genny cream ale!!

3m8C7KnuoqnF4H9tllythg.text: I came to Lebowski's randomly with a friend. Parking (as with most of Dilworth) can be quite a bear. They have a parking lot, but it's really tight. I like that there is a patio, so that is nice to sit outside. Overall, the food was okay. I really enjoyed the sweet potato tater tots. Other than that, I wasn't super impressed with the food. It's a nice place to hang out with a lot of TVs, so good for watching games.  Another big perk was they allowed my dog to sit on the patio.

uD4xRmk-On44VRjY6ESi4g.text: Even with no attachment to the Buffalo area or the Bills, we are constantly drawn to this place and it's infectious atmosphere. Easily the best wings around and the rest of the menu is great also. Nice beer list and good service. The only downside is the place is a bit small and you may have to wait a bit.  Cheers!

mN8ahqJGJG84OfQESheihA.text: We both had the Angus burger patty with salad and it was great.  The burgers were cooked well and very tasty.   Had the charbroiled taste...excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. House salad
Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger with Greek salad

H4WUh6OaMporE--x4vMXrA.text: So, on most days I have to fight myself not to drive here and get wings. Great, now I want wings. *forces self to stay in chair and write review*  This is such a great neighborhood bar. Completely laid back. And if you're from Buffalo, you'll fall even more love with this place. You'll find things like Beef on 'Weck and chicken finger subs on the menu. They're a Bills backer bar.   Lebowski's has a ton of daily specials. Lunch, dinner, drinks. They even do a twice a day happy hour. On Wednesdays, wings are half price all day. My favorites are the gold rush and good ole buffalo style sauces. Ton of burger and chicken sandwich options on the menu. I love that there's a slider nation section with a combi-nation: six wings, one slider, and fries for $11.95. The garlic fries are delicious.   Other odds and ends: Trivia on Tuesday nights. The patio is dog-friendly. House White Russians are four bucks every day. The parking lot is a little awkward and can get crowded.  So, who wants to go eat wings now?

Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings

ycivDzZBmz8Ah5dA3KDL7g.text: Food is always great, Thomas the bartender awesome, I come here often and don't plan on stopping anywhere else on east Blvd.

hm6DaW-A34JFdJYSD5WqzA.text: Lebowski or should I say Lee- average?  Service here is like an old, coal freight train, at first wasn't getting any traction.  We weren't even noticed, we sat in the corner like an neglected red headed step child.  But, once we were noticed, the service started rolling at a steady pace.  The atmosphere was comfortable like any basic neighborhood bar.  The outside patio, is outside.  The place needs more TVs and although regulars and locals go here, it felt a little bit congested inside.  It had a nice rug that tied the room together.    All of the food were spin offs from the movie for the most part.  However, I chose the Jerk style burger and like honest Abe, I can't tell a lie.  It was wicked good.  The jerkiyaki glaze, pineapple and pepper- jack was more on point than a German Short-hair.  I don't know if it's because I ask for a medium cooked burger or if it was from all of the sauce but the bun was a little soggy like a Cherri-o left in a cereal bowl.  But I ate every bite. Take note, the chips are from a bag you'd find in a pantry and not housemade.  Lastly the White Russian.  Oh the White Russian.  Like a keystone in an arch, without the White Russian to lean on, this place would crumble.  But my God, the White Russian here are something out of a dream.  The Dude would be impressed and proud.  Best White Russian I have ever had and best in Charlotte.  I recommend going here strictly to try it.  Overall, Lebowski's is a very chill, easy- going, laid back, average, neighborhood bar.  Probably won't change ever and everyone is happy the way it is.  I recommend going there with the boys for a burger and of course a While Russian.  But if you are trying to watch a game, not the best option.   Once the service gets started, it's not half bad.  Thanks for the White Russians Lebowski's.

YGb1ak3Who27AOlZLlEPAw.text: Came for the wings...duh. Fantastic! My family is from Rochester MY, so I have definitely gone and had real Buffalo wings from the source. It's been impossible to replicate down south...but these. These are damn close. Good prices, great service. We brought our dog who we also usually order food for (I know. it's absurd. We are those people.)...and I was going to pay for an entire kids meal or something and they offered a better solution since I guess we aren't the only crazy customers who do this. The food was even served in a dog bowl!! I did not request that but she loved it! I hope the chef doesn't get offended by cooking for a dog because we thought every thing was fantastic and it just added to our experience. Thank you Lebowskis!

1ZmL6TMBIns7i2gM3DgiGw.text: Like the movie from which this bar takes it's nominal inspiration, Lebowski's is fun, quirky and surprisingly substantial. It's a neighborhood bar, where you can easily feel like a regular on your first visit. The staff is friendly and attentive, even when the small dining area is packed.  The menu consists of typical bar fair.  They don't try to elevate it, or reinterpret it.. Just do it really well. The wings are said to be the best in Charlotte, which I can't argue.. They are really good wings. I enjoy the Carolina Gold Rush, a mustard-based sauce.    There seems to be drink specials every day.. At least there have been every time I visit. My favorite is Mystery Beer Monday: you tell the bartender what you like and he/she will pick something for you. What a great way to try new brews?!  The Lebowski inspired artwork livens the environment. If only there was a bowling alley!

aBCGKGwbpmKUOFSF_HM8nA.text: Outstanding wings!!!!!!!! A taste of home (Buffalo) wings mad right.  Great WNY atmosphere and awesome service. Also a great selection of brews on tap!!! If you want to know what REAL buffalo wings are like without going there? LEBOWSKI"S. is the place!!

7L8Atbi-PhXsQeBq78S_gw.text: Went to Lebowskis last week for dinner. The food and service were outstanding! I had the Haddock fish fry which was crisp on the outside and seasoned just right. My companion had the roast beef panini which he liked very much and my other friend's burger was cooked to perfection. Great beer selection. We didn't try the White Russians but they sounded delicious.  We lingered after dinner to talk and made to feel right at home. A real Buffalo treat in the heart of the south!

RAtwqNjVvSHCTx-68a3fjQ.text: This place has our favorite fish & chips.  They serve a very large fillet of fish that has a thin, crisp batter.  It is accompanied by homemade fries & slaw, however you can substitute sides.  Other sides are garlic fries, side salad, Mac & cheese, as well as more.  I had a side salad with their Greek dressing.  The Greek salad dressing Was the best! It has feta cheese in it.  My other side was the slaw.  It has a strong horseradish taste which I didn't care for, but my husband loved it.  He ordered the fish as well, with garlic fries that he thoroughly enjoyed.  We are in the covered patio.

Kktjlb_bFm5bXL2lf84pzw.text: I love this place!!! The food is always good and they had a load of options. My favorite things on the menu were the Tuscan Turkey Burger and the Spot Tots. The Tuscan style is no longer on the menu but you are still able to order it. There were no complaints from me but my friends said they would pass on the Mac and Cheese next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuscan Turkey burger and Spot Tots

zMQnZfII8r08rOH4LoO-XA.text: Comfortable atmosphere and very nice staff but neither the wings nor the Beef on Weck were anywhere near the True Buffalo standards.

v2TOaUxTI4ryLKlmmeYryw.text: Wings...AMAZING! If you don't order anything else here, get the wings! They are Award-winning and I see why. Just the right amount of crisp and the sauces we tried were both great. We also ordered the Fredonia sandwich. I wasn't a fan. It wasn't great in my opinion, but My Love loved it.

aqfAEJvoISuEktn0JOVASA.text: First time here was tonight and it was great! Very friendly and helpful staff and very fun environment! It's always nice to have a great night out spot that's not crazy expensive and has a good variety. I'm vegetarian so it's also nice to know that there are options here as well. FYI the buffalo cauliflower is wonderful! And the tacos are huge! Lol much better than I was prepared for!

eOH-QhedNPPVqmYDyEI1TA.text: My family had the BBQ wings and the On Weck Roast Beef. I had the pulled pork sandwich. Everyone enjoyed their meal. I didn't like the fries (garlic or plain). We sat outside and the atmosphere was great. Watched some football and relaxed!

photos.caption: Photo of Lebowski's Neighborhood Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. French fries

zzGqNbKXf4Lo1OezC4ebwg.text: Hands down the best wings in Charlotte. Ask for the them extra crispy btw. I have been here twice now and both times I felt more at "home" than any other bar I have visited. The people working here and visiting could not be more friendly. I have visited at least 75 different places in the last year and this place has the best neighborhood feeling by a mile. I love good wings and no other place satisfied me like this place. I met the owner today and he bought me and the guy next to me a beer. Can't wait to go back and try the beef on weck (these guys are True New Yorker's and know how to cook. If you happen to be a Buffalo Bills fan (I'm sorry) this place is for you. I highly recommend giving this place a chance.

Ploh-piBi8Rr0-8abyklfA.text: Just not a good experience. It's too bad. This is our second time trying this restaurant. With so much competition the food and service really needs to improve

JpEwxYumHZLaxZjMOiyn7A.text: I LOVE the wings here, unfortunately, I don't love the pricing structure and enforcement of it.  I had first visited a few years back when searching for a great wing restaurant (ECW has some delicious and interesting flavours but doesn't always deliver on quality and doesn't hit the basic Buffalo flavour too well) in the Charlotte area. I entered the establishment on a crowded weekend night, and saw that it was full, so I approached the hostess. I told her that I wanted place an order for two 10 pieces to go and she offered that the 25 wing order that was cheaper than two-ten pieces.  I took her up on the offer and in the meantime decided to eat my wings there (minimal service, which was to be expected on a carry-out changed dine-in).  All was well said and done.  I have ordered take-out on several other occasions and everything has been great.  This past Sunday I had promised to take my Mom to experience her best "Buffalo Wings" experience yet; Stateside outside of Buffalo. We arrived, navigated the difficult and misleading parking lot, and walked in, to be greeted by the typical [upfront] friendly service and seated within minutes.  We were quickly seated but then after 10 minutes, several employees started to look concerned and started asking if our drink order had been taken yet (it hadn't), and going off to find other employees to rectify it.  Finally someone offered to take our drink order at the outside patio (a water and an unsweet tea) and said that if she had to, she could take our food order.  I was introducing my Mother to the "deliciousness of the wings from Lebowskis" as I had learned to love them which meant I needed a 25 wing order to fulfill the duty of my eating them along with my Mom (we ended up eating 7/7 of a 10/10 order).  She loved them but the fact that a wing restaurant can't cater to special wing orders (such as the 25 wings for $20 for a middle aged lady and her son) speaks volumes about the mindset of the owner.  i started this review as five-stars, briefly dropped it to four, and then got angry about how the establishment doesn't exercise discretion amongst its patrons (aka a Mom and Son couple is different than 12 frat 'bros' when ordering wings)...  Discretion is key and it lacks here, but the food is delicious...

5cS_wPgT_1l-Xu09hQfT4Q.text: We go here a lot with our office staff. The fish is so yummy! The service is usually slow but they are super nice and accommodating. Parking is a little weird but since we normally walk here, it isn't that big of a deal for me.

pyEs4c3-lsPW5XxwW0k6og.text: Good food , horrible service, and it's freezing inside!!! Super excited about grabbing a bite to eat at the local tavern and waited forever after asking a minute to look over the menu.......worse mistake ever. Hopefully won't have to be an option anymore on east Blvd.

mv5AqccR5Ns5a_azlFypJQ.text: Great food on a nice, intimate patio!  The staff was super nice when we brought our puppy to eat with us. They even have her a bowl of water. Excellent, tasty food was much appreciated here!

_M3DcByYUiITrWh35L0M7A.text: Being from Buffalo, this felt like home.   When I go to the grocery store and ask for au jous at the deli counter they think I am nuts, but here they make that beef on weck.    They also have a real fish fry!     All nostalgia aside, food is good, but it is also kind of a typical bar.    Good place to have some fun and a casual meal.

zbcwocJC8uegbGAXv2YDDg.text: I am a wing fan of the most particular kind and these wings did not disappoint! Best wings ever! I had the house special sandwich, their version of the French Dip. The bread was to die for, horsey sauce was over the top! I got the side salad and I am telling you it was fresh, crisp and the freshly made dressing was perfect.  Patio seating, bar or table seating.

4krU2WzrkuEiD9I497X4CA.text: I go in for the Bills games. Great food, great drink specials. I would recommend the Wings, tenders, beef on weck or tilapia fish filet. Great White Russians if you are into those.

b897gkb7hm8FQicV3XPS6w.text: Still four stars. Earlier, I said there was a (semi) good football team here in Charlotte. I would like to amend that statement & issue an apology for misinformation.

Y7dulIxZHa62zeCoB1WxLA.text: We ended up at this place unplanned and we were pleasantly surprised. Our waitress was super sweet and answered all of our questions. The burgers we got were actually really good! We would definitely return.

TNKYznR3r9y4IH7Xcymh6w.text: Out shopping in Charlotte and decided to try Lebowski's based on the reviews on Yelp.  Excellent food, served quickly.  We had the wings, garlic fries, fish sandwich & the homemade goulash!  Everything was excellent.  It's clearly not a typical chain restaurant so that in its self is great.  Choice of indoor or outdoor seating.  They serve Coke products - important to some.  We loved everything & plan to return anytime we're in Charlotte. Highly recommend you try them too!

uWlvMhutDxIf31OdwoIQ7A.text: I had the "shipweck" with the haddock, roast beef slider, and garlic fries and it was impressively delicious. The garlic fries were some of the best I'd ever had and perfectly complimented the fish.  King of Pops had a stand outside selling gourmet popsicles that were a delicious dessert.

ToZfyxzQmTQ0QWTOSIj3AA.text: The staff was so friendly and nice. Also got to speak to the owner, you can tell by his character why they are so successful. The Gold Rush wings were to die for...just amazing. We also had the Lebowski burger which was just yummy...designed for meat lovers. The caraway seed bun was like none we had ever had. Also recommend the Mac and cheese with pecan bacon. We will be back on our next visit.

kt399MGcu475XLIlPwVDRA.text: I have yet to have bad food here...Beef on Kimmewick, Mac and Cheese, Garlic Fries (but I like Mac and Cheese better).    They serve Becks and have trivia.  Pretty easy parking and great staff.  Nick is great.  Decent beer collection.  Want to catch trivia.    This is the kind of place that if I lived closer to it...I would be like Norm form Cheers...they would all know my name.

nfxdMmt45xBw6tYMHyoYgA.text: Very decent place. Went there on a Friday night, the medium wings are pretty hot, the fries are very tasty, and they really have great service. Very friendly and laid back. I had the combination plate which included wings, fries, and a slider for only 11.95.

vEffDeZwSiFWwNTLa4LVBA.text: Cool place, tasty food and obviously delicious white Russians! Prices were good. Place isn't big but it didn't feel crowded. Friendly folks there. My cousin said their wings are the best!

18bplK-4aEI41zNGEFM_Sw.text: Best wings in town, great service, friendly staff.  All around great food and atmosphere.

fRvvfIuHl9-dL-u3abzE9A.text: Had a late lunch with my Shmoopy. Meatloaf:Outstanding Beef weck:Yummo Return soon: Yea Dude

pbF4xx2Rceg9VDarv7q92Q.text: Great wings, tacos, beer choices and service. Would definitely recommend this place if you are from out of town and want some small bites at happy hour time with good beer and people.

rJxZsAVoQ6nJauKMImojYw.text: I don't know why I've never written a review expressing our love for this restaurant!  We've been coming here since they opened, and, although we don't go out to eat very often, this is our go-to place for special events when we want to have a good time, eat good food, get great service and relax.  I usually get a fish plate, or the chicken wings, which are some of the BEST in Charlotte!  The Burgers are of course delicious, and the plates are plentiful.  They have a good selection of draft beers and a full bar with a variety of signature drinks.  It's just a great place all the way around and we hope it sticks around for a long time.
